translated: or the path of perfect buddhahood?‚ÄùüîΩThe Blessed One said, ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, bodhisattva great beings do not enter into the secure state of a bodhisattva by the path of the hearers,

original: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni nyan thos kyi lam gyis byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par mi 'jug / rang sangs rgyas kyi lam gyis byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par mi 'jug / rab 'byor 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems
analyzed: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni nyan thos kyi lam gyis byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par mi 'jug / rang sangs rgyas kyi lam gyis byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par mi 'jug / rab 'byor 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems
translated: nor do they enter into the secure state of a bodhisattva by the path of the solitary buddhas.

original: dpa' chen po ni lam thams cad la bslabs shing byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par 'jug go //
analyzed: dpa' chen po ni lam thams cad la bslabs shing byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par 'jug go //
translated: Subh≈´ti, it is because bodhisattva great beings train in all paths and enter into the secure state of a bodhisattva.

original: 'di lta ste dper na dgra bcom pa ni chos thams cad la bslabs shing yang dag pa'i skyon med pa la 'jug ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste dper na dgra bcom pa ni chos thams cad la bslabs shing yang dag pa'i skyon med pa la 'jug ste /
translated: For example, Subh≈´ti, an arhat, having trained in all dharmas, enters into the faultless.

original: nam 'bras bu'i lam ma grub kyi bar du 'bras bu thob par mi byed do //
analyzed: nam 'bras bu'i lam ma grub kyi bar du 'bras bu thob par mi byed do //
translated: Until the path of fruition is established, he does not attain the fruition.

original: rab 'byor de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yang lam thams cad bsgrubs shing byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par 'jug ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yang lam thams cad bsgrubs shing byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par 'jug ste /
translated: Subh≈´ti, in the same way, a bodhisattva mahƒÅsattva, having accomplished all paths, enters into the faultlessness of a bodhisattva.

original: nam rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin ma thob kyi bar du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par mi byed do //
analyzed: nam rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin ma thob kyi bar du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par mi byed do //
translated: Until the vajropama samƒÅdhi is attained, he does not attain omniscience.üîΩImmediately upon attaining that samƒÅdhi, with the wisdom of one instant, he attains omniscience.‚Äù

original: des ting nge 'dzin de thob ma thag tu skad cig gcig dang ldan pa'i shes rab kyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par byed do zhes bya ba ni phyin ci log la log par rtog pa yin no /
analyzed: des ting nge 'dzin de thob ma thag tu skad cig gcig dang ldan pa'i shes rab kyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par byed do zhes bya ba ni phyin ci log la log par rtog pa yin no /
translated: This is the mistaken conception regarding error.

original: // / gsol pa /
analyzed: // / gsol pa /
translated: He said:

original: bcom ldan 'das gal te de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos lam thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bgyis te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal te de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos lam thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bgyis te /
translated: Blessed One, if bodhisattva great beings complete all the paths in that way,üîΩ

original: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon ma mchis par 'jug par bgyi na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon ma mchis par 'jug par bgyi na /
translated: Blessed One, if bodhisattva great beings are to enter into the faultlessness of the bodhisattvas after completing all the paths,

original: bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar brgyad pa'i lam yang gzhan /üîΩrgyun du zhugs pa'i lam yang gzhan /üîΩlan cig phyir 'ong bar zhugs pa'i lam yang gzhan /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar brgyad pa'i lam yang gzhan / rgyun du zhugs pa'i lam yang gzhan / lan cig phyir 'ong bar zhugs pa'i lam yang gzhan /
translated: then, Blessed One, the path of the eighth-lowest stage is one thing,üîΩthe path of the stream enterer is another,

original: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i lam yang gzhan /üîΩphyir mi 'ong bar zhugs pa'i lam yang @173a * //üîΩgzhan / phyir mi 'ong ba'i lam yang gzhan /üîΩdgra bcom par zhugs pa'i lam yang gzhan /
analyzed: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i lam yang gzhan / phyir mi 'ong bar zhugs pa'i lam yang @173a * // gzhan / phyir mi 'ong ba'i lam yang gzhan / dgra bcom par zhugs pa'i lam yang gzhan /
translated: the path of the once-returner is another,üîΩthe path of the non-returner is another,

original: dgra bcom pa'i lam yang gzhan /üîΩrang sangs rgyas su zhugs pa'i lam yang gzhan /üîΩrang sangs rgyas kyi lam yang gzhan /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i lam yang gzhan / rang sangs rgyas su zhugs pa'i lam yang gzhan / rang sangs rgyas kyi lam yang gzhan /
translated: the path of the arhat is another,üîΩthe path of the pratyekabuddha is another,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi lam yang gzhan te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi lam yang gzhan te /
translated: and the path of the thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddha is another.

original: bcom ldan 'das gal te lam de dag gzhan dang gzhan na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal te lam de dag gzhan dang gzhan na /
translated: Blessed One, if those paths are different,

original: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos lam thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bgyis te /
analyzed: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos lam thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bgyis te /
translated: how do bodhisattva great beings complete all the paths

original: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon ma mchis par 'jug par bgyi ;
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon ma mchis par 'jug par bgyi ;
translated: and enter into the bodhisattva‚Äôs faultless state?

original: bcom ldan 'das gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos lam thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bgyis na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos lam thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bgyis na /
translated: Blessed One, if bodhisattva great beings complete all the paths,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag brgyad pa'i lam bsgrubs shing brgyad par mi 'gyur ram /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag brgyad pa'i lam bsgrubs shing brgyad par mi 'gyur ram /
translated: will those bodhisattva great beings practice the path of the eighth-stage being but not become eighth-stage beings?

original: mthong ba'i lam bsgrubs shing rgyun du zhugs par mi 'gyur ram /üîΩbsgom pa'i lam bsgrubs shing lan cig phyir 'ong bar zhugs pa'am /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam bsgrubs shing rgyun du zhugs par mi 'gyur ram / bsgom pa'i lam bsgrubs shing lan cig phyir 'ong bar zhugs pa'am /
translated: Will they practice the path of seeing but not become stream-enterers?

original: lan cig phyir 'ong bar mi 'gyur ram /üîΩphyir mi 'ong bar zhugs pa'am /üîΩphyir mi 'ong bar mi 'gyur ram /üîΩdgra bcom par zhugs pa'am /
analyzed: lan cig phyir 'ong bar mi 'gyur ram / phyir mi 'ong bar zhugs pa'am / phyir mi 'ong bar mi 'gyur ram / dgra bcom par zhugs pa'am /
translated: Will they practice the path of meditation but not become once-returners or enter the path of the once-returner?üîΩWill they not become nonreturners or enter the path of the nonreturner?

original: dgra bcom par mi 'gyur ram /
analyzed: dgra bcom par mi 'gyur ram /
translated: Will they not become arhats or enter the path of the arhat?

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi lam bsgrubs shing rang sangs rgyas su mi 'gyur ram /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi lam bsgrubs shing rang sangs rgyas su mi 'gyur ram /
translated: Would they not become pratyekabuddhas after practicing the path of a pratyekabuddha?

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni brgyad par gyur nas byang chub sems dpa'i skyon ma mchis par 'jug pa'i gnas dang skabs ma mchis te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni brgyad par gyur nas byang chub sems dpa'i skyon ma mchis par 'jug pa'i gnas dang skabs ma mchis te /
translated: ‚ÄúBlessed One, it is not possible for a bodhisattva great being who has become an arhat to enter into the maturity of a bodhisattva.

original: de ni gnas ma lags so //
analyzed: de ni gnas ma lags so //
translated: That is not possible.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon ma mchis par ma chud par yang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ba'i gnas ma mchis /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon ma mchis par ma chud par yang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ba'i gnas ma mchis /
translated: It is not possible for someone who has not entered into the maturity of a bodhisattva to attain the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub thob nas byang chub sems dpa'i skyon ma mchis par 'jug pa'i gnas ma mchis /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub thob nas byang chub sems dpa'i skyon ma mchis par 'jug pa'i gnas ma mchis /
translated: It is not possible for someone who has attained the result of stream enterer, the result of once-returner, the result of non-returner, the state of a worthy one, or the state of a pratyekabuddha to enter into the maturity of a bodhisattva.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon ma mchis par ma chud par rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ba'i gnas ma mchis na bcom ldan 'das de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po lam thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bgyis shing @173b byang chub
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon ma mchis par ma chud par rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ba'i gnas ma mchis na bcom ldan 'das de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po lam thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bgyis shing @173b byang chub
translated: ‚ÄúLord, if bodhisattvas do not enter into the secure state of a bodhisattva, there is no chance that they will attain the knowledge of all aspects, so how should great bodhisattva beings, having completed all the paths,

original: sems dpa'i skyon ma mchis par 'jug par 'gyur ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i skyon ma mchis par chud par gyur nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ba dang / bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad yongs su spong bar 'gyur ba ji ltar 'tshal bar bgyi /
analyzed: sems dpa'i skyon ma mchis par 'jug par 'gyur ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i skyon ma mchis par chud par gyur nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ba dang / bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad yongs su spong bar 'gyur ba ji ltar 'tshal bar bgyi /
translated: enter into the secure state of a bodhisattva, and having entered into the secure state of a bodhisattva, how should they attain the knowledge of all aspects, and how should they completely destroy all residual impressions, connections, and afflictive emotions?‚Äù

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor de de bzhin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor de de bzhin no //
translated: ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, it is so!

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: It is just as you have said!

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po brgyad par gyur to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po brgyad par gyur to //
translated: Subh≈´ti, great bodhisattva beings who have newly set out in the vehicle should be made to stand in the perfection of wisdom, and they should be made to stand in the perfection of concentration, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of patience, the perfection of morality, and the perfection of giving.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu thob pa'am /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu thob pa'am /
translated: or who have attained the fruit of once-returning, or who have attained the fruit of non-returning, or who have attained the state of a worthy one,

original: dgra bcom pa nyid thob pa'am /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid thob pa'am /
translated: or who have attained individual enlightenment,

original: rang byang chub thob par gyur nas byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par 'jug pa'i gnas dang skabs med de /
analyzed: rang byang chub thob par gyur nas byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par 'jug pa'i gnas dang skabs med de /
translated: there is no opportunity for them to enter into the secure state of a bodhisattva.

original: de ni gnas ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni gnas ma yin no //
translated: That is not possible.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par ma chud par yang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ba'i gnas med do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par ma chud par yang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ba'i gnas med do //
translated: And without entering into the secure state of a bodhisattva, it is not possible to attain the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subh≈´ti said,

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos lam 'di snyed ma thob par rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par ji ltar mi 'gyur lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos lam 'di snyed ma thob par rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par ji ltar mi 'gyur lags /
translated: ‚ÄúBlessed One, how is it that bodhisattva great beings do not attain the knowledge of all aspects without attaining all these paths?‚Äù

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,üîΩ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, it is because bodhisattva great beings do not apprehend any phenomenon as being either joined or disjoined, as being either defiled or purified, as being either increased or decreased, as being either taken up or put down, as being either born or extinguished, as being either past, future, or present, or as being either internal or external.

original: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
translated: Subh≈´ti, here, starting from the first production of the thought,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: when the bodhisattva mahƒÅsattva practices the six perfections,

original: shes pa dang mthong bas sa brgyad las yongs su 'da' ste /
analyzed: shes pa dang mthong bas sa brgyad las yongs su 'da' ste /
translated: he transcends the eight levels with knowledge and seeing.

original: brgyad gang zhe na /
analyzed: brgyad gang zhe na /
translated: What are the eight?

original: dkar po rnam par mthong ba'i sa dang / rigs kyi sa dang / brgyad pa'i sa dang / mthong ba'i sa dang / bsrabs pa'i sa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sa dang / byas pa rtogs pa'i sa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sa ste /
analyzed: dkar po rnam par mthong ba'i sa dang / rigs kyi sa dang / brgyad pa'i sa dang / mthong ba'i sa dang / bsrabs pa'i sa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sa dang / byas pa rtogs pa'i sa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sa ste /
translated: They are the Joyful level, the Stainless level, the Shining level, the Brilliance level, the Immovability level, the Subduing level, the Manifestation level, and the Far-reaching level.

original: sa bstan pa brgyad po 'di dag las shes pa dang mthong ba las 'das nas lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid kyis byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par 'jug go //
analyzed: sa bstan pa brgyad po 'di dag las shes pa dang mthong ba las 'das nas lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid kyis byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par 'jug go //
translated: Having transcended the eight levels that are taught with knowledge and seeing, he enters into the faultlessness of the bodhisattva through the knowledge of the aspects of the path.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par zhugs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi bag chags kyis mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad rab tu spong ngo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par zhugs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi bag chags kyis mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad rab tu spong ngo //
translated: Having entered into the faultlessness of a Bodhisattva, he abandons all the afflictions that are connected with the imprints of the knowledge of a knower of paths.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rab 'byor de la brgyad pa'i ye shes dang spong ba gang yin pa de yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bzod pa'o //üîΩ@174a * // rgyun du zhugs pa'i ye shes dang spong ba gang yin pa de yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bzod pa /üîΩlan cig phyir 'ong ba'i ye shes dang spong ba gang yin pa de yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bzod pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor de la brgyad pa'i ye shes dang spong ba gang yin pa de yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bzod pa'o // @174a * // rgyun du zhugs pa'i ye shes dang spong ba gang yin pa de yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bzod pa / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i ye shes dang spong ba gang yin pa de yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bzod pa /
translated: Subh≈´ti, the knowledge and abandonment of the eighth-lowest stage is also the acceptance of a bodhisattva great being.üîΩThe knowledge and abandonment of a stream enterer is also the acceptance of a bodhisattva great being.üîΩThe knowledge and abandonment of a once returner is also the acceptance of a bodhisattva great being.

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i ye shes dang spong ba gang yin pa de yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bzod pa /
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i ye shes dang spong ba gang yin pa de yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bzod pa /
translated: The knowledge and abandonment of a non-returner is also the acceptance of a bodhisattva great being.

original: dgra bcom pa'i ye shes dang spong ba gang yin pa de yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bzod pa /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i ye shes dang spong ba gang yin pa de yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bzod pa /
translated: Whatever is the knowledge and abandonment of an arhat is also the acceptance of a bodhisattva great being.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi ye shes dang spong ba gang yin pa de yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bzod pa ste /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi ye shes dang spong ba gang yin pa de yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bzod pa ste /
translated: Whatever is the knowledge and abandonment of a pratyekabuddha is also the acceptance of a bodhisattva great being.

original: de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi lam yongs su rdzogs par byas shing lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid kyi ye shes kyis byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par 'jug go //
analyzed: de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi lam yongs su rdzogs par byas shing lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid kyi ye shes kyis byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par 'jug go //
translated: Therefore, a bodhisattva great being, having completed the paths of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas, enters into the acceptance of a bodhisattva through the knowledge of the aspects of the path.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par zhugs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bag chags kyis mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad rab tu spong ngo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par zhugs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bag chags kyis mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad rab tu spong ngo //
translated: Having entered into the acceptance of a bodhisattva, he abandons all the afflictions that are connected with the imprints of the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni lam thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byas nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas shing 'bras bu ltar sems can thams cad kyi nye
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni lam thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byas nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas shing 'bras bu ltar sems can thams cad kyi nye
translated: Subh≈´ti, in this way, having completed all the paths, the bodhisattva mahƒÅsattva attains manifestly perfect buddhahood in unsurpassed, genuinely perfect enlightenment and becomes a Dharma king for all sentient beings.üîΩ

original: bar 'tsho bar 'gyur ro /üîΩ// / bam po drug cu gnyis pa /
analyzed: bar 'tsho bar 'gyur ro / // / bam po drug cu gnyis pa /
translated: In this way, Subh≈´ti, having completed all the paths, the bodhisattva great beings fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening and become a support for all beings, like a fruit.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das gang nyan thos kyi lam dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi lam dang / sangs rgyas kyi lam de dag las lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid kyi lam gang lags /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das gang nyan thos kyi lam dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi lam dang / sangs rgyas kyi lam de dag las lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid kyi lam gang lags /
translated: ‚Äù ‚ÄúLord, from among the ≈õrƒÅvaka path, the pratyekabuddha path, and the buddha path, which is the path that is the knowledge of path aspects?‚Äù

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid rnam par dag par bsgrub par bya ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid rnam par dag par bsgrub par bya ste /

translated: not conjoined with or disjoined from formlessness.üîΩThey cannot be shown,

original: bstan du med pa dang / bstan du med par ldan pa yang ma yin bral ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: bstan du med pa dang / bstan du med par ldan pa yang ma yin bral ba yang ma yin no //
translated: not conjoined with or disjoined from what cannot be shown.üîΩThey are unimpeded,

original: thogs pa med pa dang / thogs pa med par ldan pa yang ma yin bral ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: thogs pa med pa dang / thogs pa med par ldan pa yang ma yin bral ba yang ma yin no //
translated: not conjoined with or disjoined from what is unimpeded.

original: mtshan nyid med pa dang mtshan nyid med par ldan pa yang ma yin bral ba yang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po'i phyogs la log par rtog pa yin no /
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa dang mtshan nyid med par ldan pa yang ma yin bral ba yang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po'i phyogs la log par rtog pa yin no /
translated: It is not without defining characteristics, nor is it endowed with defining characteristics, nor is it free from defining characteristics.

original: // / rab 'byor 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi gzugs med pa /
analyzed: // / rab 'byor 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi gzugs med pa /
translated: This is the formless perfection of the bodhisattva great beings,

original: bstan du med pa /
analyzed: bstan du med pa /
translated: the perfection that is not shown,

original: @178a * // thogs pa med pa /
analyzed: @178a * // thogs pa med pa /
translated: the perfection that is not impeded,

original: mtshan nyid med pa /
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa /
translated: the perfection that is without defining characteristics,

original: mtshan nyid gcig pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: mtshan nyid gcig pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: the perfection that is of one defining characteristic.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bslab par bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva great beings should train in it.

analyzed: des de la bslabs nas chos kyi mtshan nyid gang yang dmigs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Having trained in it, they will not apprehend any defining characteristic of dharmas at all.

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa ;
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa ;
translated: Subh≈´ti said,

original: bcom ldan 'das 'o na gzugs kyi mtshan nyid la bslab par mi bgyi'am /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'o na gzugs kyi mtshan nyid la bslab par mi bgyi'am /
translated: ‚ÄúWell then, Blessed One, should they not train in the defining characteristic of form?

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid la bslab par mi bgyi'am /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid la bslab par mi bgyi'am /
translated: Should one not train in the characteristics of feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness?

original: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid la bslab par mi bgyi'am /
analyzed: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid la bslab par mi bgyi'am /
translated: Should one not train in the characteristics of the sense spheres, elements, and dependent origination?

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i mtshan nyid la bslab par mi bgyi'am /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i mtshan nyid la bslab par mi bgyi'am /

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mtshan nyid la bslab par mi bgyi'am /üîΩnang stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid la bslab par mi bgyi'am /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mtshan nyid la bslab par mi bgyi'am / nang stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid la bslab par mi bgyi'am /
translated: Should one not train in the characteristics of the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom?üîΩShould one not train in the characteristics of inner emptiness?

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar gyi mtshan nyid la bslab par mi bgyi'am /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar gyi mtshan nyid la bslab par mi bgyi'am /
translated: Should one not train in the characteristics of up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature?

original: bsam gtan dang po'i mtshan nyid la bslab par mi bgyi'am /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po'i mtshan nyid la bslab par mi bgyi'am /
translated: ‚ÄúShould one not train in the defining characteristics of the first concentration?

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa dang / bsam gtan gsum pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi pa'i mtshan nyid la bslab par mi bgyi'am /
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa dang / bsam gtan gsum pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi pa'i mtshan nyid la bslab par mi bgyi'am /
translated: Should one not train in the defining characteristics of the second, third, and fourth concentrations?

original: byams pa chen po'i mtshan nyid la bslab par mi bgyi'am /
analyzed: byams pa chen po'i mtshan nyid la bslab par mi bgyi'am /
translated: Should one not train in the defining characteristics of great love?

original: snying rje chen po dang / dga' ba chen po dang / btang snyoms chen po'i mtshan nyid la bslab par mi bgyi'am /
analyzed: snying rje chen po dang / dga' ba chen po dang / btang snyoms chen po'i mtshan nyid la bslab par mi bgyi'am /
translated: Should one not train in the defining characteristics of great compassion, great joy, and great equanimity?

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa dang / cung zad med pa'i skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid la bslab par mi bgyi'am /
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa dang / cung zad med pa'i skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid la bslab par mi bgyi'am /
translated: Should one not train in the defining characteristics of the meditative absorption of the sense field of infinite space, the meditative absorption of the sense field of infinite consciousness, the meditative absorption of the sense field of nothing-at-all, and the meditative absorption of the sense field of neither perception nor non-perception?

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid la bslab par mi bgyi'am /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid la bslab par mi bgyi'am /
translated: Should one not train in the defining characteristics of the applications of mindfulness?

original: yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i mtshan nyid la bslab par mi bgyi'am /üîΩstong pa nyid dang mtshan ma @178b med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams kyi mtshan nyid la bslab par mi bgyi'am /
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i mtshan nyid la bslab par mi bgyi'am / stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma @178b med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams kyi mtshan nyid la bslab par mi bgyi'am /
translated: Should they not train in the characteristics of the four kinds of correct understanding, the four supports for miraculous abilities, the five faculties, the five powers, the seven aspects of enlightenment, and the noble eightfold path?üîΩShould they not train in the characteristics of the emptiness, signlessness, and aspirationlessness meditative stabilizations, the liberations, the serial absorptions, the clairvoyances, the meditative stabilizations, and the dhƒÅra·πáƒ´ gateways?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po'i mtshan nyid la bslab par mi bgyi'am /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po'i mtshan nyid la bslab par mi bgyi'am /
translated: Should they not train in the characteristics of the ten tathƒÅgata powers, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, great love, and great compassion?

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi mtshan nyid la bslab par mi bgyi'am /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi mtshan nyid la bslab par mi bgyi'am /
translated: Should they not train in the characteristics of the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas?

original: sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa'i mtshan nyid la bslab par mi bgyi'am /üîΩkun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam 'phags pa'i bden pa'i mtshan nyid la bslab par mi bgyi'am /
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa'i mtshan nyid la bslab par mi bgyi'am / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam 'phags pa'i bden pa'i mtshan nyid la bslab par mi bgyi'am /
translated: Should they not train in the characteristics of the noble truth of suffering?üîΩShould they not train in the characteristics of the noble truths of the origin of suffering, the cessation of suffering, and the path?

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba lugs dang mthun pa dang / lugs dang mi mthun pa'i mtshan nyid la bslab par mi bgyi'am /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba lugs dang mthun pa dang / lugs dang mi mthun pa'i mtshan nyid la bslab par mi bgyi'am /

original: 'du byas kyi khams kyi mtshan nyid la bslab par mi bgyi'am /
analyzed: 'du byas kyi khams kyi mtshan nyid la bslab par mi bgyi'am /
translated: Should they not train in the characteristics of the conditioned element?

original: 'dus ma byas kyi khams kyi mtshan nyid la bslab par mi bgyi'am /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyi khams kyi mtshan nyid la bslab par mi bgyi'am /

original: bcom ldan 'das gal te chos 'di dag gi mtshan nyid la bslab par mi bgyi na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal te chos 'di dag gi mtshan nyid la bslab par mi bgyi na /

original: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos chos thams cad kyi mtshan nyid la bslabs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos chos thams cad kyi mtshan nyid la bslabs te /

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sa las 'da' bar 'gyur /
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sa las 'da' bar 'gyur /
translated: they will transcend the ≈õrƒÅvaka and pratyekabuddha levels.

analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sa las ma 'das na ji ltar byang chub sems dpa'i skyon ma mchis par 'jug par 'gyur /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon ma mchis par ma zhugs na /

analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma thob na /

analyzed: ji ltar chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar bgyi /

analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo ma bskor na ji ltar nyan thos kyi theg pa'am /
translated: If they do not turn the wheel of the Dharma, how will they liberate beings from sa·πÉsƒÅra through the vehicle of the ≈õrƒÅvakas,

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'am /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'am /
translated: the vehicle of the pratyekabuddhas,

original: theg pa chen pos sems can rnams 'khor ba las sgrol bar bgyi /
analyzed: theg pa chen pos sems can rnams 'khor ba las sgrol bar bgyi /
translated: or the Great Vehicle?‚Äù

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,üîΩ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, it is so!

original: rab 'byor gal te chos la la zhig la mtshan nyid yod na ni de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos mtshan nyid de la bslab par yang 'gyur na /
analyzed: rab 'byor gal te chos la la zhig la mtshan nyid yod na ni de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos mtshan nyid de la bslab par yang 'gyur na /
translated: Subh≈´ti, if any dharma had a defining mark, then the bodhisattva great beings would have to train in that defining mark.

original: chos thams cad la mtshan nyid med cing gzugs med pa /
analyzed: chos thams cad la mtshan nyid med cing gzugs med pa /
translated: But all dharmas are without defining mark, are formless,

original: bstan du med pa /
analyzed: bstan du med pa /
translated: cannot be shown,

original: thogs pa med pa @179a * //
analyzed: thogs pa med pa @179a * //
translated: are unimpeded,

original: 'di ltar mtshan nyid med par mtshan nyid gcig pas na /
analyzed: 'di ltar mtshan nyid med par mtshan nyid gcig pas na /

original: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos mtshan nyid la yang bslab par mi bya /
analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos mtshan nyid la yang bslab par mi bya /
translated: Therefore, the bodhisattva great beings should not train in a defining mark,

original: mtshan nyid med pa la yang bslab par mi bya'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa la yang bslab par mi bya'o //
translated: and should not train in a defining mark that is nonexistent.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

original: sngan chad mtshan nyid med par gyur ba de phyis mtshan nyid yod par 'gyur ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: sngan chad mtshan nyid med par gyur ba de phyis mtshan nyid yod par 'gyur ba ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not that what was previously without a defining mark later becomes one with a defining mark.

original: rab 'byor chos 'di dag ni sngan chad kyang mtshan nyid med la /
analyzed: rab 'byor chos 'di dag ni sngan chad kyang mtshan nyid med la /
translated: Subh≈´ti, these dharmas were previously without a defining mark,üîΩand

original: de ltar yang mtshan nyid med pas na de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos mtshan nyid la yang bslab par mi bya /
analyzed: de ltar yang mtshan nyid med pas na de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos mtshan nyid la yang bslab par mi bya /
translated: Therefore, Subh≈´ti, bodhisattva great beings should not train in the defining characteristics,

original: mtshan nyid med pa la yang bslab par mi bya'o//
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa la yang bslab par mi bya'o//
translated: and they should not train in the absence of defining characteristics.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung /
translated: Whether the tathƒÅgatas arise or do not arise,üîΩthis defining-characteristic element remains just as it is.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ma byung yang rung ste mtshan nyid med pa'i dbyings 'di ni de bzhin du gnas pa'o zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid la log par rtog pa yin no /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ma byung yang rung ste mtshan nyid med pa'i dbyings 'di ni de bzhin du gnas pa'o zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid la log par rtog pa yin no /
translated: This is the misconception about defining characteristics.

original: // / gsol pa /
analyzed: // / gsol pa /
translated: Subh≈´ti said,

original: bcom ldan 'das gal te de ltar chos thams cad la mtshan nyid ma mchis shing mtshan nyid tha dad pa yang ma lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal te de ltar chos thams cad la mtshan nyid ma mchis shing mtshan nyid tha dad pa yang ma lags /
translated: ‚ÄúLord, if all phenomena are like that, without defining characteristics, not different defining characteristics,

original: mtshan nyid gcig pa yang ma lags na /
analyzed: mtshan nyid gcig pa yang ma lags na /
translated: and not the same defining characteristic,

original: de ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa mchis par 'gyur /
analyzed: de ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa mchis par 'gyur /
translated: how can the bodhisattva great beings‚Äô cultivation of the perfection of wisdom come about?

original: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa ma mchis par ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos nyan thos kyi sa'am /üîΩrang sangs rgyas kyi sa las 'da' bar mi nus so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa ma mchis par ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos nyan thos kyi sa'am / rang sangs rgyas kyi sa las 'da' bar mi nus so //
translated: Blessed One, without cultivating the perfection of wisdom, bodhisattva great beings cannot transcend the ≈õrƒÅvaka level or the pratyekabuddha level.

original: nyan thos kyi sa'am rang sangs rgyas kyi sa las ma 'das par ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos byang chub sems dpa'i skyon ma mchis par 'jug par mi nus so //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi sa'am rang sangs rgyas kyi sa las ma 'das par ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos byang chub sems dpa'i skyon ma mchis par 'jug par mi nus so //
translated: Without transcending the ≈õrƒÅvaka level or the pratyekabuddha level, bodhisattva great beings cannot enter into the secure state of a bodhisattva.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon ma mchis par ma zhugs par ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa skye bar mi nus so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon ma mchis par ma zhugs par ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa skye bar mi nus so //
translated: Without entering into the secure state of a bodhisattva, bodhisattva great beings cannot produce the acceptance that phenomena are not produced.

original: mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa ma skyes par ni mngon par shes pa sgrub par mi nus so //
analyzed: mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa ma skyes par ni mngon par shes pa sgrub par mi nus so //
translated: Without producing the acceptance that phenomena are not produced, they cannot accomplish the superknowledges.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i mngon par shes pa ma bsgrubs par ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bgyi ba dang / sems can yongs su smin par bgyi bar mi nus so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i mngon par shes pa ma bsgrubs par ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bgyi ba dang / sems can yongs su smin par bgyi bar mi nus so //
translated: Without accomplishing the bodhisattvas‚Äô superknowledges, it is not possible to purify a buddhafield and bring beings to maturity.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa dang / sems can yongs su smin par ma bgyis par ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob @179b par mi nus so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa dang / sems can yongs su smin par ma bgyis par ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob @179b par mi nus so //
translated: Without purifying a buddhafield and bringing beings to maturity, it is not possible to attain the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par ma bgyis par ni chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar mi nus so //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par ma bgyis par ni chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar mi nus so //
translated: Without attaining the knowledge of all aspects, it is not possible to turn the wheel of the Dharma.

original: chos kyi 'khor lo ma bskor bar ni sems can rnams rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la dgod par mi nus so //
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo ma bskor bar ni sems can rnams rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la dgod par mi nus so //
translated: Without turning the wheel of the Dharma, it is not possible to establish beings in the result of stream enterer.

original: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu la dgong par mi nus so //
analyzed: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu la dgong par mi nus so //
translated: It is not possible to establish them in the result of once-returner, the result of non-returner, or the result of a worthy one.

original: rang byang chub la dgod par mi nus so //
analyzed: rang byang chub la dgod par mi nus so //
translated: It is not possible to establish them in a pratyekabuddha‚Äôs awakening.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la dgod par mi nus so //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la dgod par mi nus so //
translated: they are not able to establish them in unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: sems can rnams sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bgyi ba'i dang po la dgod par mi nus so //
analyzed: sems can rnams sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bgyi ba'i dang po la dgod par mi nus so //
translated: They are not able to establish beings in the first thing that is the basis for the creation of merit that arises from giving.

original: tshul khrims las byung ba'i bsod nams bgyi ba'i dngos po dang / bsgom pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bgyi ba'i dngos po la dgod par mi nus so //
analyzed: tshul khrims las byung ba'i bsod nams bgyi ba'i dngos po dang / bsgom pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bgyi ba'i dngos po la dgod par mi nus so //
translated: They are not able to establish them in the thing that is the basis for the creation of merit that arises from morality, or in the thing that is the basis for the creation of merit that arises from meditation.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor de de bzhin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor de de bzhin no //
translated: ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, it is so!

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: It is so!

original: rab 'byor chos thams cad ni mtshan nyid med pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor chos thams cad ni mtshan nyid med pa ste /
translated: Subh≈´ti, all phenomena are without a defining mark.

original: mtshan nyid tha dad pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: mtshan nyid tha dad pa'ang ma yin /
translated: They are not different defining marks.

original: mtshan nyid gcig pa'am ma yin no //
analyzed: mtshan nyid gcig pa'am ma yin no //
translated: They are not the same defining mark.

original: gsol pa / de ji ltar chos thams cad mtshan nyid ma mchis na ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom par 'gyur /
analyzed: gsol pa / de ji ltar chos thams cad mtshan nyid ma mchis na ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom par 'gyur /
translated: ‚Äù Subh≈´ti said, ‚ÄúIf all phenomena are without a defining mark, how will they cultivate the perfection of wisdom?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: ‚Äù The Lord said,üîΩ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, all phenomena are without a defining mark.

original: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sgom pa ni mtshan nyid tha dad pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sgom pa ni mtshan nyid tha dad pa yang ma yin /
translated: Subh≈´ti, the cultivation of the perfection of wisdom by bodhisattva great beings is not different characteristics,

original: mtshan nyid gcig pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: mtshan nyid gcig pa yang ma yin te /
translated: and it is not the same characteristic.

original: rab 'byor mtshan nyid med pa sgom pa ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor mtshan nyid med pa sgom pa ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o //
translated: Subh≈´ti, the cultivation of the perfection of wisdom by bodhisattva great beings is the cultivation of the absence of characteristics.

original: gsol pa / de ji ltar na mtshan nyid ma mchis pa sgom pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom par 'gyur /
analyzed: gsol pa / de ji ltar na mtshan nyid ma mchis pa sgom pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom par 'gyur /
translated: He said, ‚ÄúHow is the cultivation of the absence of characteristics the cultivation of the perfection of wisdom?‚Äù

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: chos thams cad rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe destruction of the cultivation of all phenomena is the cultivation of the perfection of wisdom.‚Äù

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de ji ltar chos thams cad rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa lags /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de ji ltar chos thams cad rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa lags /
translated: He said, ‚ÄúLord, how is the destruction of the cultivation of all phenomena the cultivation of the perfection of wisdom?‚Äù

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied:

original: gzugs rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom ba'o //üîΩtshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed @180a * //
analyzed: gzugs rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom ba'o // tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed @180a * //
translated: The cultivation of the destruction of the cultivation of form is the cultivation of the perfection of wisdom.

original: rnams dang / rnam par shes pa rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o /
analyzed: rnams dang / rnam par shes pa rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o /
translated: The cultivation of the destruction of the cultivation of feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness is the cultivation of the perfection of wisdom.

original: mig rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o //
analyzed: mig rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o //
translated: The cultivation of the destruction of the cultivation of the eyes is the cultivation of the perfection of wisdom.

original: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o //
analyzed: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o //
translated: The cultivation of the destruction of the cultivation of the ears, nose, tongue, body, and mind is the cultivation of the perfection of wisdom.

original: gzugs rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o //
translated: The cultivation of the destruction of the cultivation of a form is the cultivation of the perfection of wisdom.

original: sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg dang / chos rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o //
analyzed: sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg dang / chos rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o //
translated: The destruction of the meditation on sound, smell, taste, touch, and dharmas is the meditation on the perfection of wisdom.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o //
translated: The destruction of the meditation on eye-consciousness is the meditation on the perfection of wisdom.

original: rna ba'i rnam par shes ba dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o //
analyzed: rna ba'i rnam par shes ba dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o //
translated: The destruction of the meditation on ear-consciousness, nose-consciousness, tongue-consciousness, body-consciousness, and mind-consciousness is the meditation on the perfection of wisdom.

original: mig gi 'dus te reg pa rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o //
analyzed: mig gi 'dus te reg pa rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o //
translated: The destruction of the meditation on eye-contact is the meditation on the perfection of wisdom.

original: rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa dang / sna'i 'dus te reg pa dang / lce'i 'dus te reg pa dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o //
analyzed: rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa dang / sna'i 'dus te reg pa dang / lce'i 'dus te reg pa dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o //
translated: The cultivation of the perfection of wisdom is the destruction of the cultivation of the union of the ear and sound, the union of the nose and smell, the union of the tongue and taste, the union of the body and touch, and the union of the mind and dharmas.

original: mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o //
analyzed: mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o //
translated: The cultivation of the perfection of wisdom is the destruction of the cultivation of the feeling that arises from the condition of the union of the eye and form.

original: rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / sna'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / lce'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o //
analyzed: rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / sna'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / lce'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o //
translated: The cultivation of the perfection of wisdom is the destruction of the cultivation of the feeling that arises from the condition of the union of the ear and sound, the union of the nose and smell, the union of the tongue and taste, the union of the body and touch, and the union of the mind and dharmas.

original: sa'i khams rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o /
analyzed: sa'i khams rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o /
translated: The destruction of the meditation on the earth element is the meditation on the perfection of wisdom.

original: chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams dang / nam mkha'i khams dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o //
analyzed: chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams dang / nam mkha'i khams dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o //
translated: The destruction of the meditation on the water element, the fire element, the wind element, the space element, and the consciousness element is the meditation on the perfection of wisdom.

original: rten cing 'brel par @180b 'byung ba rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par @180b 'byung ba rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o //
translated: The destruction of the meditation on dependent origination is the meditation on the perfection of wisdom.

original: ma rig pa rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o //
translated: The destruction of the meditation on ignorance is the meditation on the perfection of wisdom.

original: 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang / gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa dang / skye ba dang / rga shi rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyi pa sgom pa'o //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang / gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa dang / skye ba dang / rga shi rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyi pa sgom pa'o //
translated: The destruction of the meditation on volitions, consciousness, name-and-form, the six sense spheres, contact, feeling, craving, appropriation, existence, birth, and old age and death is the meditation on the perfection of wisdom.

original: mya ngan la sogs pa rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o //
analyzed: mya ngan la sogs pa rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o //
translated: The destruction of the meditation on sorrow, etc. is the meditation on the perfection of wisdom.

original: blang ba rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o //
analyzed: blang ba rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o //
translated: The destruction of the meditation on acceptance is the meditation on the perfection of wisdom.

original: dor ba rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o //
analyzed: dor ba rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o //
translated: The destruction of the meditation on rejection is the meditation on the perfection of wisdom.

original: bsam gtan dang po rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o //
translated: The destruction of the meditation on the first concentration is the meditation on the perfection of wisdom.

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa dang / bsam gtan gsum pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi pa rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa dang / bsam gtan gsum pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi pa rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o //
translated: the cultivation of the second concentration, the third concentration, and the fourth concentration is the cultivation of the perfection of wisdom.

original: byams pa rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o //
analyzed: byams pa rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o //
translated: The cultivation of loving kindness is the cultivation of the perfection of wisdom.

original: snying rje chen po dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o //
analyzed: snying rje chen po dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o //
translated: The cultivation of great compassion, joy, and equanimity is the cultivation of the perfection of wisdom.

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o //
translated: The cultivation of the sphere of infinite space is the cultivation of the perfection of wisdom.

original: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa dang / cung zad med pa'i skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jug pa rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o //
analyzed: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa dang / cung zad med pa'i skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jug pa rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o //
translated: The cultivation, the engagement, and the destruction of the cultivation of the meditative absorption of the sphere of infinite consciousness, the meditative absorption of the sphere of nothingness, and the meditative absorption of the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception is the cultivation of the perfection of wisdom.

original: sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o //
translated: The destruction of the cultivation of the recollection of the Buddha is the cultivation of the perfection of wisdom.

original: chos rjes su dran pa dang / dge 'dun rjes su dran pa dang / tshul khrims rjes su dran pa dang / tshul khrims rjes su dran pa dang / gtong rjes su dran pa dang / lha rjes su dran pa dang / skyo ba rjes su dran pa dang /
analyzed: chos rjes su dran pa dang / dge 'dun rjes su dran pa dang / tshul khrims rjes su dran pa dang / tshul khrims rjes su dran pa dang / gtong rjes su dran pa dang / lha rjes su dran pa dang / skyo ba rjes su dran pa dang /
translated: The recollection of the Dharma, the recollection of the Sa·πÖgha, the recollection of morality, the recollection of generosity, the recollection of the deities, the recollection of tranquility, the recollection of inhalation and exhalation,

original: dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba rjes su dran pa dang / 'chi ba rjes su dran pa dang / @181a * //
analyzed: dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba rjes su dran pa dang / 'chi ba rjes su dran pa dang / @181a * //

original: lus kyi rnam pa rjes su dran pa rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o //
analyzed: lus kyi rnam pa rjes su dran pa rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o //
translated: mindfulness of the insubstantial,üîΩmindfulness of the self,üîΩmindfulness of sentient beings,üîΩmindfulness of life,üîΩmindfulness of birth,üîΩmindfulness of youth,üîΩmindfulness of old age,üîΩmindfulness of sickness,üîΩmindfulness of death,üîΩmindfulness of suffering,üîΩmindfulness of separation,

original: mi rtag pa'i 'du shes rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i 'du shes rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o //
translated: mindfulness of impermanence,üîΩmindfulness of the body,üîΩmindfulness of the unpleasant,üîΩmindfulness of the insubstantial,üîΩmindfulness of the self,üîΩmindfulness of sentient beings,

original: sdug bsngal gyi 'du shes dang / bdag med pa'i 'du shes dang / mi sdug pa'i 'du shes dang / dngos po med pa'i 'du shes dang / bdag gi 'du shes dang / sems can gyi 'du shes dang / srog gi 'du shes dang / skye ba'i 'du shes dang /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi 'du shes dang / bdag med pa'i 'du shes dang / mi sdug pa'i 'du shes dang / dngos po med pa'i 'du shes dang / bdag gi 'du shes dang / sems can gyi 'du shes dang / srog gi 'du shes dang / skye ba'i 'du shes dang /
translated: mindfulness of life,üîΩmindfulness of birth,üîΩmindfulness of youth,üîΩmindfulness of old age,üîΩmindfulness of sickness,üîΩmindfulness of death,üîΩmindfulness of suffering,üîΩmindfulness of separation,üîΩmindfulness of impermanence,üîΩmindfulness of the body,

original: gso ba'i 'du shes dang / skyes bu'i 'du shes dang / gang zag gi 'du shes dang / shed las skyes kyi 'du shes dang / shed bu'i 'du shes dang / byed pa po'i 'du shes dang / tshor ba po'i 'du shes dang / shes pa po'i 'du shes dang /üîΩmthong ba po'i 'du shes rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o //
analyzed: gso ba'i 'du shes dang / skyes bu'i 'du shes dang / gang zag gi 'du shes dang / shed las skyes kyi 'du shes dang / shed bu'i 'du shes dang / byed pa po'i 'du shes dang / tshor ba po'i 'du shes dang / shes pa po'i 'du shes dang / mthong ba po'i 'du shes rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o //
translated: the notion of a person, the notion of an individual, the notion of a human being, the notion of a human, the notion of a maker, the notion of a feeler, the notion of a knower,üîΩthe notion of a seer, the notion of an hearer, the notion of a smeller, the notion of a taster, the notion of a toucher, the notion of a thinker, the notion of an agent, the notion of an experiencer, the notion of an knower,

original: rtag pa'i 'du shes rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o //üîΩmi rtag pa'i 'du shes dang / bde ba'i 'du shes dang / sdug bsngal gyi 'du shes dang / bdag gi 'du shes dang / bdag med pa'i 'du shes rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o //

translated: the notion of a perceiver, the notion of an observer, the notion of an enjoyer, the notion of a mother, the notion of a father, the notion of a son, the notion of a daughter, the notion of a monk, the notion of a nun, the notion of an upasaka, the notion of an upasika, the notion of a brahmin, the notion of a kshatriya, the notion of a vaishya, the notion of a shudra, the notion of a god, the notion of a human, the notion of a naga, the notion of a yaksha, the notion of a gandharva, the notion of a rakshasa, the notion of a preta, the notion of a pisacha, the notion of a hell being, the notion of a hell, the notion of an animal, the notion of an animal realm, the notion of a god, the notion of a god‚Äôs realm, the notion of a human, the notion of a human realm, the notion of an ascetic, the notion of a brahmin, the notion of an ascetic‚Äôs realm, the notion of a brahmin‚Äôs realm, the notion of a world, the notion of a world system, the notion of a world system with four continents, the notion of a great trichiliocosm, the notion of a buddha, the notion of a buddha field, the notion of a buddha field‚Äôs adornments, the notion of a buddha‚Äôs lifespan, the notion of a buddha‚Äôs Dharma remaining in the world, the notion of a buddha‚Äôs Dharma remaining in the world, the notion of a buddha‚Äôs Dharma remaining in the world, the notion of a buddha‚Äôs Dharma remaining in the world, the notion of a buddha‚Äôs Dharma remaining in the world, the notion of a buddha‚Äôs Dharma remaining in the world, the notion of a buddha‚Äôs Dharma remaining in the world, the notion of a buddha‚Äôs Dharma

original: zhe ba'i 'du shes dang / ma zhi ba'i 'du shes rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o //
analyzed: zhe ba'i 'du shes dang / ma zhi ba'i 'du shes rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o //
translated: The destruction of the meditation on the notion of peace and the notion of non-peace is the meditation on the perfection of wisdom.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o //
translated: The destruction of the meditation on the applications of mindfulness is the meditation on the perfection of wisdom.

original: yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / lam rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / lam rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o //
translated: The destruction of the meditation on the right efforts, the legs of magical power, the faculties, the powers, the limbs of awakening, and the path is the meditation on the perfection of wisdom.

original: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o //
translated: The destruction of the meditation on emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness is the meditation on the perfection of wisdom.

original: rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o //üîΩrtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / rtog pa med pa dpyod pa tsam gyi ting nge 'dzin dang / rtog pa med cing dpyod pa @181b med pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o // rtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / rtog pa med pa dpyod pa tsam gyi ting nge 'dzin dang / rtog pa med cing dpyod pa @181b med pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o //
translated: The destruction of the meditation on the eight liberations and the nine serial absorptions is the meditation on the perfection of wisdom.üîΩThe destruction of the meditation on the concentration with applied-thought and sustained-thought, the concentration without applied-thought but with sustained-thought, and the concentration without applied-thought and without sustained-thought is the meditation on the perfection of wisdom.

original: sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o //
translated: The destruction of the meditation on the noble truth of suffering is the meditation on the perfection of wisdom.

original: kun 'byung 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / 'gog pa 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / lam 'phags pa'i bden pa rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o //
analyzed: kun 'byung 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / 'gog pa 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / lam 'phags pa'i bden pa rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o //
translated: The destruction of the cultivation of the noble truth of the origin, the noble truth of cessation, and the noble truth of the path is the cultivation of the perfection of wisdom.

original: sdug bsngal shes pa dang / kun 'byung shes pa dang / 'gog pa shes pa dang / lam shes pa rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal shes pa dang / kun 'byung shes pa dang / 'gog pa shes pa dang / lam shes pa rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o //
translated: The destruction of the cultivation of the knowledge of suffering, the knowledge of the origin, the knowledge of cessation, and the knowledge of the path is the cultivation of the perfection of wisdom.

original: zad pa shes pa rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o //
analyzed: zad pa shes pa rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o //
translated: The destruction of the cultivation of the knowledge of destruction is the cultivation of the perfection of wisdom.

original: mi skye ba shes pa dang / chos shes pa dang / rjes su 'gro ba shes pa dang / kun rdzob shes pa dang / 'dris pa shes pa dang / sgra ji bzhin pa shes pa rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o //
analyzed: mi skye ba shes pa dang / chos shes pa dang / rjes su 'gro ba shes pa dang / kun rdzob shes pa dang / 'dris pa shes pa dang / sgra ji bzhin pa shes pa rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o //
translated: The destruction of the cultivation of the knowledge of non-arising, the knowledge of dharmas, the knowledge of subsequent realization, the knowledge of convention, the knowledge of what is possible, and the knowledge that accords with what is heard is the cultivation of the perfection of wisdom.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o //
translated: The destruction of the cultivation of the perfection of generosity is the cultivation of the perfection of wisdom.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o //üîΩnang stong pa nyid rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o // nang stong pa nyid rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o //
translated: The destruction of the cultivation of the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom is the cultivation of the perfection of wisdom.üîΩThe destruction of the cultivation of inner emptiness is the cultivation of the perfection of wisdom.

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o //
translated: The destruction of the cultivation of up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature is the cultivation of the perfection of wisdom.

original: mngon par shes pa drug rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa drug rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o //
translated: The destruction of the cultivation of the six superknowledges is the cultivation of the perfection of wisdom.

original: ting nge 'dzin thams cad rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thams cad rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o //
translated: The destruction of the cultivation of all meditative absorptions is the cultivation of the perfection of wisdom.

original: gzungs kyi sgo thams cad rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o //üîΩde bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po rnam par sgom pa rnam @182a * //
analyzed: gzungs kyi sgo thams cad rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o // de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po rnam par sgom pa rnam @182a * //
translated: The destruction of the cultivation of all dhƒÅra·πáƒ´ gateways is the cultivation of the perfection of wisdom.

original: par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o //
analyzed: par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o //
translated: The destruction of the cultivation of the ten powers of the tathƒÅgatas, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, great love, and great compassion is the cultivation of the perfection of wisdom.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres ba bco brgyad rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres ba bco brgyad rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o //
translated: The destruction of the cultivation of the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha is the cultivation of the perfection of wisdom.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o //
translated: The meditation on the result of stream-enterer being destroyed is the meditation on the perfection of wisdom.

original: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o //üîΩrang byang chub rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o //üîΩrnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o //
analyzed: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o // rang byang chub rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o // rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o //
translated: The meditation on the result of once-returner, the result of non-returner, and the state of a worthy one being destroyed is the meditation on the perfection of wisdom.üîΩThe meditation on a pratyekabuddha‚Äôs awakening being destroyed is the meditation on the perfection of wisdom.üîΩThe meditation on up to the knowledge of all aspects being destroyed is the meditation on the perfection of wisdom.

original: bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o //
analyzed: bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o //
translated: The meditation on the abandonment of all afflictions together with the instincts toward them being destroyed is the meditation on the perfection of wisdom.‚ÄùüîΩSubh≈´ti said,

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
