translated: ‚ÄúLord, how is the meditation on form being destroyed the meditation on the perfection of wisdom?üîΩHow is the meditation on feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness being destroyed the meditation on the perfection of wisdom?üîΩHow is the meditation on the eyes being destroyed the meditation on the perfection of wisdom?üîΩHow is the meditation on the ears, nose, tongue, body, and mind being destroyed the meditation on the perfection of wisdom?üîΩHow is the meditation on a form being destroyed the meditation on the perfection of wisdom?üîΩHow is the meditation on a sound, a smell, a taste, a feeling, and a dharma being destroyed the meditation on the perfection of wisdom?üîΩHow is the meditation on the eye constituent being destroyed the meditation on the perfection of wisdom?üîΩHow is the meditation on the ear constituent, the nose constituent, the tongue constituent, the body constituent, and the thinking-mind constituent being destroyed the meditation on the perfection of wisdom?üîΩHow is the meditation on the form constituent being destroyed the meditation on the perfection of wisdom?üîΩHow is the meditation on the sound constituent, the smell constituent, the taste constituent, the feeling constituent, and the dharma constituent being destroyed the meditation on the perfection of wisdom?üîΩHow is the meditation on the eye sense field being destroyed the meditation on the perfection of wisdom?üîΩHow is the meditation on the nose sense field, the tongue sense field, the body sense field, and the thinking-mind sense field being destroyed the meditation on the perfection of wisdom?üîΩHow is the meditation on the form sense field being destroyed the meditation on the perfection of wisdom?üîΩHow is the meditation on the sound sense field, the smell sense field, the taste sense field, the feeling sense field, and the dharma sense field being destroyed the meditation on the perfection of wisdom?

original: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na gzugs rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na gzugs rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa lags /
translated: Blessed One, how is the meditation on the disintegration of the meditation on form the meditation on the perfection of wisdom?

original: ji ltar na tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa lags /
analyzed: ji ltar na tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa lags /
translated: How is the meditation on the disintegration of the meditation on feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness the meditation on the perfection of wisdom?

original: ji ltar na skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'drel  par 'byung ba rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa lags /
analyzed: ji ltar na skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'drel  par 'byung ba rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa lags /
translated: How is the meditation on the disintegration of the meditation on the sense domains, constituents, and dependent origination the meditation on the perfection of wisdom?

original: ji ltar na blang ba dang dor ba rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa lags /
analyzed: ji ltar na blang ba dang dor ba rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa lags /
translated: How is the meditation on the disintegration of the meditation on adopting and rejecting the meditation on the perfection of wisdom?

original: ji ltar na bsam gtan dang po dang / bsam gtan gnyis pa dang / bsam gtan gsum pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi pa dang / byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms dang / nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa dang /
analyzed: ji ltar na bsam gtan dang po dang / bsam gtan gnyis pa dang / bsam gtan gsum pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi pa dang / byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms dang / nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa dang /
translated: How are the first concentration, the second concentration, the third concentration, the fourth concentration, love, compassion, joy, equanimity, the meditative absorption of the sense field of infinite space,üîΩthe meditative absorption of the sense field of infinite consciousness, the meditative absorption of the sense field of nothing-at-all, and the meditative absorption of the sense field of neither perception nor non-perception cultivated?

original: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa dang / cung zad med pa'i skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes @182b rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa lags /
analyzed: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa dang / cung zad med pa'i skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes @182b rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa lags /
translated: How is the cultivation of the perfection of wisdom the complete destruction of the cultivation of the meditative absorption of the cessation of perceptions and feelings?‚Äù

original: ji ltar na sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa dang / chos rjes su dran pa dang / dge 'dun rjes su dran pa dang / tshul khrims rjes su dran pa dang / gtong ba rjes su dran pa dang / lha rjes su dran pa dang /
analyzed: ji ltar na sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa dang / chos rjes su dran pa dang / dge 'dun rjes su dran pa dang / tshul khrims rjes su dran pa dang / gtong ba rjes su dran pa dang / lha rjes su dran pa dang /
translated: How does one cultivate the perfection of wisdom by means of the recollection of the Buddha, the recollection of the Dharma, the recollection of the Sa·πÖgha, the recollection of morality, the recollection of generosity, the recollection of the deities,

original: skye ba rjes su dran pa dang / dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba rjes su dran pa dang / 'chi ba rjes su dran pa dang / lus kyi rnam pa rjes su dran pa rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa lags /
analyzed: skye ba rjes su dran pa dang / dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba rjes su dran pa dang / 'chi ba rjes su dran pa dang / lus kyi rnam pa rjes su dran pa rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa lags /
translated: the recollection of birth, the recollection of inhalation and exhalation, the recollection of death, and the recollection of the aspects of the body?

original: ji ltar na mi rtag pa'i 'du shes dang / sdug bsngal ba'i 'du shes dang / bdag med pa'i 'du shes dang / mi sdug pa'i 'du shes dang / dngos po med pa'i 'du shes dang / bdag gi 'du shes dang / sems can gyi 'du shes dang /
analyzed: ji ltar na mi rtag pa'i 'du shes dang / sdug bsngal ba'i 'du shes dang / bdag med pa'i 'du shes dang / mi sdug pa'i 'du shes dang / dngos po med pa'i 'du shes dang / bdag gi 'du shes dang / sems can gyi 'du shes dang /
translated: How does one cultivate the perception of impermanence, the perception of suffering, the perception of non-self, the perception of the unattractive, the perception of non-existence, the perception of self, the perception of sentient beings,

original: srog gi 'du shes dang / skye ba'i 'du shes dang / gso ba'i 'du shes dang / skyes bu'i 'du shes dang / gang zag gi 'du shes dang / shed las skyes pa'i 'du shes dang / shed bu'i 'du shes dang / byed pa pa'i 'du shes dang /
analyzed: srog gi 'du shes dang / skye ba'i 'du shes dang / gso ba'i 'du shes dang / skyes bu'i 'du shes dang / gang zag gi 'du shes dang / shed las skyes pa'i 'du shes dang / shed bu'i 'du shes dang / byed pa pa'i 'du shes dang /
translated: the notion of life, the notion of birth, the notion of nurture, the notion of a person, the notion of an individual, the notion of a human being, the notion of a human, the notion of an agent,

original: tshor ba po'i 'du shes dang / shes pa po'i 'du shes dang / mthong ba po'i 'du shes rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa lags /
analyzed: tshor ba po'i 'du shes dang / shes pa po'i 'du shes dang / mthong ba po'i 'du shes rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa lags /
translated: the notion of a feeler, the notion of a knower, and the notion of a seer.

original: ji ltar na rtag pa'i 'du shes dang / mi rtag pa'i 'du shes dang / bde ba'i 'du shes dang / sdug bsngal ba'i 'du shes dang / bdag gi 'du shes dang / bdag med pa'i 'du shes dang / zhi ba'i 'du shes dang / ma zhi ba'i 'du shes rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa lags /
analyzed: ji ltar na rtag pa'i 'du shes dang / mi rtag pa'i 'du shes dang / bde ba'i 'du shes dang / sdug bsngal ba'i 'du shes dang / bdag gi 'du shes dang / bdag med pa'i 'du shes dang / zhi ba'i 'du shes dang / ma zhi ba'i 'du shes rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa lags /
translated: ‚ÄúHow is it that the cultivation of the notion of permanence, the notion of impermanence, the notion of happiness, the notion of suffering, the notion of a self, the notion of no-self, the notion of peace, and the notion of not peace is the cultivation of the perfection of wisdom?‚Äù

original: ji ltar na byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa lags /
analyzed: ji ltar na byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa lags /
translated: How is the cultivation of the aspects of enlightenment a cultivation of the perfection of wisdom?

original: ji ltar na stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu rnam par sgom par rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa lags /üîΩji ltar na rtog pa dang bcas /üîΩdpyod pa dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / rtog pa med pa la dpyod pa tsam gyi ting nge 'dzin dang / rtog pa med cing dpyod pa med pa'i ting @183a * //
analyzed: ji ltar na stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu rnam par sgom par rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa lags / ji ltar na rtog pa dang bcas / dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / rtog pa med pa la dpyod pa tsam gyi ting nge 'dzin dang / rtog pa med cing dpyod pa med pa'i ting @183a * //
translated: How is the cultivation of emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness, the eight liberations, and the nine serial absorptions a cultivation of the perfection of wisdom?

original: nge 'dzin rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa lags /
analyzed: nge 'dzin rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa lags /
translated: How is the cultivation of the concentration with applied thought and sustained thought, the concentration without applied thought but with sustained thought, and the concentration without applied thought and sustained thought a cultivation of the perfection of wisdom?

original: ji ltar na sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / kun 'byung 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / 'gog pa 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / lam 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / sdug bsngal shes pa dang / kun 'byung shes pa dang / 'gog pa shes pa dang /
analyzed: ji ltar na sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / kun 'byung 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / 'gog pa 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / lam 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / sdug bsngal shes pa dang / kun 'byung shes pa dang / 'gog pa shes pa dang /
translated: the knowledge of suffering,üîΩthe knowledge of the origin of suffering,üîΩthe knowledge of the cessation of suffering,üîΩand the knowledge of the path,üîΩthe knowledge of exhaustion,üîΩthe knowledge of phenomena,üîΩthe knowledge of subsequent realization,

original: lam shes pa dang / zad pa shes pa dang / chos shes pa dang / rjes su 'gro ba shes pa dang / kun rdzob shes pa dang / 'dris pa shes pa dang / sgra ji bzhin shes pa rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa lags /
analyzed: lam shes pa dang / zad pa shes pa dang / chos shes pa dang / rjes su 'gro ba shes pa dang / kun rdzob shes pa dang / 'dris pa shes pa dang / sgra ji bzhin shes pa rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa lags /
translated: the knowledge of convention,üîΩthe knowledge of familiarity,üîΩand the knowledge of the way things are,üîΩcultivated?

original: ji ltar na pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa lags /
analyzed: ji ltar na pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa lags /
translated: How is the cultivation of the perfection of wisdom the destruction of the cultivation of all the perfections and all the emptinesses?

original: ji ltar na mngon par shes pa drug dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang / gzungs kyi sgo thams cad dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang /
analyzed: ji ltar na mngon par shes pa drug dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang / gzungs kyi sgo thams cad dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang /
translated: How are the six clairvoyances, all the meditative stabilizations, all the dhƒÅra·πáƒ´ gateways, the ten powers of a tathƒÅgata, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, great love,

original: snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa lags /
analyzed: snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa lags /
translated: great compassion, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha cultivated and destroyed?

original: ji ltar na rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar dang /
analyzed: ji ltar na rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar dang /
translated: How are the result of stream enterer, the result of once-returner, the result of non-returner, the state of a worthy one, a pratyekabuddha‚Äôs awakening, up to the knowledge of all aspects,üîΩand

original: ji ltar na bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad rnam par spong ba rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa lags /
analyzed: ji ltar na bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad rnam par spong ba rnam par sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa lags /
translated: How is it that they abandon, meditate on, and destroy the afflictions that connect with latent tendencies?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, here, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: gzugs dngos po yod ces bya bar mi sgom mo //üîΩtshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa dngos po yod ces bya bar mi sgom mo //
analyzed: gzugs dngos po yod ces bya bar mi sgom mo // tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa dngos po yod ces bya bar mi sgom mo //
translated: they do not meditate on form as an existent thing.üîΩThey do not meditate on feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness as existent things.

original: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing @183b 'brel par 'byung ba dngos po yod ces bya bar mi sgom mo //
analyzed: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing @183b 'brel par 'byung ba dngos po yod ces bya bar mi sgom mo //
translated: They do not meditate on the sense spheres, elements, or dependent origination as existent things.

original: blang ba dang dor ba dngos po yod ces bya bar mi sgom mo //
analyzed: blang ba dang dor ba dngos po yod ces bya bar mi sgom mo //
translated: They do not meditate on adopting and rejecting as existent things.

original: bsam gtan dang po dang / bsam gtan gnyis pa dang / bsam gtan gsum pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi pa dang / byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms dang / nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa dang /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po dang / bsam gtan gnyis pa dang / bsam gtan gsum pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi pa dang / byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms dang / nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa dang /
translated: the first concentration, the second concentration, the third concentration, the fourth concentration, love, compassion, joy, equanimity, the meditative absorption of the sense field of infinite space,

original: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa dang / cung zad med pa'i skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa dngos po yod ces bya bar mi sgom mo //
analyzed: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa dang / cung zad med pa'i skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa dngos po yod ces bya bar mi sgom mo //
translated: the meditative absorption of the sense field of infinite consciousness, the meditative absorption of the sense field of nothing-at-all, and the meditative absorption of the sense field of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa dang / chos rjes su dran pa dang / dge 'dun rjes su dran pa dang / tshul khrims rjes su dran pa dang / gtong ba rjes su dran pa dang / lha rjes su dran pa dang / skye ba rjes su dran pa dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa dang / chos rjes su dran pa dang / dge 'dun rjes su dran pa dang / tshul khrims rjes su dran pa dang / gtong ba rjes su dran pa dang / lha rjes su dran pa dang / skye ba rjes su dran pa dang /
translated: He does not meditate that the recollection of the Buddha, the recollection of the Dharma, the recollection of the Sa·πÖgha, the recollection of morality, the recollection of generosity, the recollection of the deities, the recollection of giving up,

original: dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba rjes su dran pa dang / 'chi ba rjes su dran pa dang / lus kyi rnam pa rjes su dran pa dngos po yod ces bya bar mi sgom mo //
analyzed: dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba rjes su dran pa dang / 'chi ba rjes su dran pa dang / lus kyi rnam pa rjes su dran pa dngos po yod ces bya bar mi sgom mo //
translated: He does not cultivate the mindfulness of breathing, the mindfulness of death, and the mindfulness of the form of the body as real.

original: mi rtag pa'i 'du shes dang / sdug bsngal ba'i 'du shes dang / bdag med pa'i 'du shes dang / mi sdug pa'i 'du shes dang / dngos po med pa'i 'du shes dang / bdag gi 'du shes dang / sems can gyi 'du shes dang /
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i 'du shes dang / sdug bsngal ba'i 'du shes dang / bdag med pa'i 'du shes dang / mi sdug pa'i 'du shes dang / dngos po med pa'i 'du shes dang / bdag gi 'du shes dang / sems can gyi 'du shes dang /
translated: He does not cultivate the perception of impermanence, the perception of suffering, the perception of non-self, the perception of the unattractive, the perception of non-existence, the perception of self, the perception of sentient beings,

original: srog gi 'du shes dang / skye ba'i 'du shes dang / gso ba'i 'du shes dang / skyes bu'i 'du shes dang / gang zag gi 'du shes dang / shed las skyes kyi 'du shes dang / shed bu'i 'du shes dang / byed pa po'i 'du shes dang /
analyzed: srog gi 'du shes dang / skye ba'i 'du shes dang / gso ba'i 'du shes dang / skyes bu'i 'du shes dang / gang zag gi 'du shes dang / shed las skyes kyi 'du shes dang / shed bu'i 'du shes dang / byed pa po'i 'du shes dang /
translated: the perception of life, the perception of birth, the perception of nourishment, the perception of a person, the perception of an individual, the perception of one born of Manu, the perception of a human, the perception of a maker,

original: tshor ba po'i 'du shes dang / shes pa po'i 'du shes dang / mthong ba po'i 'du shes dngos po yod ces bya bar mi sgom mo //
analyzed: tshor ba po'i 'du shes dang / shes pa po'i 'du shes dang / mthong ba po'i 'du shes dngos po yod ces bya bar mi sgom mo //
translated: the perception of a feeler, the perception of a knower, and the perception of a seer as real.

original: rtag pa'i 'du shes dang / mi rtag pa'i 'du shes dang / bde ba'i 'du shes dang / sdug bsngal ba'i 'du shes dang / bdag gi 'du shes dang / bdag med pa'i 'du shes dang / zhi ba'i 'du shes dang / ma zhi ba'i 'du shes dngos po yod ces bya bar mi sgom mo //
analyzed: rtag pa'i 'du shes dang / mi rtag pa'i 'du shes dang / bde ba'i 'du shes dang / sdug bsngal ba'i 'du shes dang / bdag gi 'du shes dang / bdag med pa'i 'du shes dang / zhi ba'i 'du shes dang / ma zhi ba'i 'du shes dngos po yod ces bya bar mi sgom mo //
translated: He does not cultivate the notion that the aggregates, the elements, and the sense-fields are real.üîΩHe does not cultivate the notion that the four applications of mindfulness, the four right efforts, the four bases of supernatural power, the five spiritual faculties, the five strengths, the seven factors of enlightenment, and the eightfold noble path are real.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams dngos po yod ces bya bar mi sgom mo //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams dngos po yod ces bya bar mi sgom mo //
translated: He does not cultivate the notion that the ten powers of the Tathagata, the four fearlessnesses, the four unobstructed understandings, the eighteen dharmas exclusive to a Buddha, and great love are real.üîΩHe does not cultivate the notion that great compassion is real.

original: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge @184a * //
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge @184a * //
translated: He does not cultivate the notion that the emptiness, the signless, and the wishless are real.üîΩHe does not cultivate the notion that the eight deliverances and the nine serial absorptions are real.üîΩHe does not cultivate the notion that the fruit of the stream-winner is real.üîΩHe does not cultivate the notion that the fruit of the once-returner is real.

original: 'dzin dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dngos po yod ces bya bar mi sgom mo //üîΩrtog pa dang bcas /
analyzed: 'dzin dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dngos po yod ces bya bar mi sgom mo //üîΩrtog pa dang bcas /
translated: He does not cultivate the notion that the fruit of the non-returner is real.üîΩHe does not cultivate the notion that the fruit of the arhat is real.üîΩHe does not cultivate the notion that the pratyekabuddha‚Äôs awakening is real.üîΩHe does not cultivate the notion that the knowledge of all modes is real.üîΩHe does not cultivate the notion that the fruit of a Stream-winner is real.üîΩHe does not cultivate the notion that the fruit of a Once-returner is real.üîΩHe does not cultivate the notion that the fruit of a Non-returner is real.üîΩHe does not cultivate the notion that the fruit of an Arhat is real.üîΩHe does not cultivate the notion that the Pratyekabuddha‚Äôs Awakening is real.üîΩHe does not cultivate the notion that the knowledge of all modes is real.

original: dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / rtog pa med pa la dpyod pa tsam gyi ting nge 'dzin dang / rtog pa med cing dpyod pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dngos po yod ces bya bar mi sgom mo //üîΩsdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / kun 'byung 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / 'gog pa 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / lam 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / sdug bsngal shes pa dang / kun 'byung shes pa dang / 'gog pa shes pa dang /
analyzed: dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / rtog pa med pa la dpyod pa tsam gyi ting nge 'dzin dang / rtog pa med cing dpyod pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dngos po yod ces bya bar mi sgom mo // sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / kun 'byung 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / 'gog pa 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / lam 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / sdug bsngal shes pa dang / kun 'byung shes pa dang / 'gog pa shes pa dang /
translated: the concentration that is accompanied by investigation, the concentration that is without applied thought but only sustained thought, and the concentration that is without either applied or sustained thought.üîΩHe does not cultivate the noble truth of suffering, the noble truth of the arising of suffering, the noble truth of the cessation of suffering, and the noble truth of the path.üîΩHe does not cultivate the knowledge of suffering, the knowledge of the arising of suffering, the knowledge of the cessation of suffering, and the knowledge of the path.

original: lam shes pa dang / zad pa shes pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa dang / chos shes pa dang / rjes su 'gro ba shes pa dang / kun rdzob shes pa dang / 'dris pa shes pa dang / sgra ji bzhin pa shes pa dngos po yod ces bya bar mi sgom mo //
analyzed: lam shes pa dang / zad pa shes pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa dang / chos shes pa dang / rjes su 'gro ba shes pa dang / kun rdzob shes pa dang / 'dris pa shes pa dang / sgra ji bzhin pa shes pa dngos po yod ces bya bar mi sgom mo //
translated: He does not cultivate the knowledge of destruction, the knowledge of non-arising, the knowledge of dharmas, inferential knowledge, the knowledge of conventional truth, the knowledge of the path, and the knowledge of the sphere of reality.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang ; stong pa nyid thams cad dngos po yod ces bya bar mi sgom mo //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang ; stong pa nyid thams cad dngos po yod ces bya bar mi sgom mo //
translated: He does not cultivate the thought that the perfections, the emptinesses, and the dharmas on the side of awakening are existent things.

original: mngon par shes pa drug dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang / gzungs kyi sgo thams cad dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa drug dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang / gzungs kyi sgo thams cad dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang /
translated: He does not cultivate the thought that the six clairvoyances, the concentrations, the mnemonic spells, the ten powers of a TathƒÅgata, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, great love,

original: snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dngos po yod ces bya bar mi sgom mo //
analyzed: snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dngos po yod ces bya bar mi sgom mo //
translated: great compassion, and the eighteen aspects of the unshared qualities of a Buddha are existent things.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar dang / bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad spong ba dngos po yod ces bya bar mi sgom mo //üîΩde ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar dang / bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad spong ba dngos po yod ces bya bar mi sgom mo // de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: the fruit of entering the stream, the fruit of being tied to one more rebirth, the fruit of no longer being subject to rebirth, arhatship, individual enlightenment, up to the knowledge of all aspects, and the relinquishment of all propensities to the afflictions,

original: rab 'byor dngos po'i 'du shes can la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa med do //
analyzed: rab 'byor dngos po'i 'du shes can la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa med do //
translated: ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, those who have the notion of an existent thing do not cultivate the perfection of wisdom.

original: dngos po'i 'du shes can la bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa med do //
analyzed: dngos po'i 'du shes can la bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa med do //
translated: Those who have the notion of an existent thing do not cultivate the perfection of concentration, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of patience, the perfection of morality, or the perfection of giving.

original: dngos po'i 'du shes can la bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad @184b spangs pa'i bar du med do //
analyzed: dngos po'i 'du shes can la bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad @184b spangs pa'i bar du med do //
translated: For those who have the notion of a real thing, there is no giving, no morality, no patience, no perseverance, no concentration, no wisdom, up to no abandonment of all residual impressions, predispositions, and latent tendencies.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: 'di ltar de dngos po la 'di ni bdag go zhes bya bar mtha' gnyis la chags te /
analyzed: 'di ltar de dngos po la 'di ni bdag go zhes bya bar mtha' gnyis la chags te /
translated: Because they are attached to the two extremes, thinking, ‚ÄòThis is my real thing.‚Äô

original: sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab dang / bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa'i bar 'di ni bdag go zhes bya bar mtha' gnyis la chags par gyur pas /
analyzed: sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab dang / bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa'i bar 'di ni bdag go zhes bya bar mtha' gnyis la chags par gyur pas /
translated: They are attached to the two extremes, thinking, ‚ÄòThis is my giving, morality, patience, perseverance, concentration, wisdom, up to abandonment of all residual impressions, predispositions, and latent tendencies.‚Äô

original: gang mtha' gnyis la chags par 'gyur ba de la ni thar pa med de /
analyzed: gang mtha' gnyis la chags par 'gyur ba de la ni thar pa med de /
translated: Those who are attached to the two extremes have no liberation.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: rab 'byor dngos po'i 'du shes can la ni sbyin pa'ang med /
analyzed: rab 'byor dngos po'i 'du shes can la ni sbyin pa'ang med /
translated: Subh≈´ti, for those who have the notion of a real thing, there is no giving,

original: tshul khrims kyang med /üîΩbzod pa yang med ;
analyzed: tshul khrims kyang med / bzod pa yang med ;
translated: no morality,üîΩno patience,

original: brtson 'grus kyang med /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyang med /
translated: no perseverance,

original: bsam gtan yang med /
analyzed: bsam gtan yang med /
translated: no concentration,

original: shes rab kyang med /
analyzed: shes rab kyang med /
translated: There is no wisdom.

original: bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa'i bar du yongs su shes pa med na /
analyzed: bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa'i bar du yongs su shes pa med na /
translated: Up to the complete knowledge of the abandonment of all the afflictions that connect to latent tendencies is not known.

original: de thar par 'gyur ba lta ba las 'ong /üîΩgsol pa / bcom ldan 'das dngos po mchis zhes bgyi ba ni ci lags /
analyzed: de thar par 'gyur ba lta ba las 'ong / gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das dngos po mchis zhes bgyi ba ni ci lags /
translated: How could that be liberation?

original: dngos po ma mchis zhes bgyi ba ni ci lags /üîΩbcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: dngos po ma mchis zhes bgyi ba ni ci lags / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: Subh≈´ti said, ‚ÄúBlessed One, what is called an existent thing, what is called a nonexistent thing?‚Äù

original: rab 'byor gnyis ni dngos po yod pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor gnyis ni dngos po yod pa'o //
translated: The Blessed One said, ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, duality is an existent thing.

original: mi gnyis pa ni dngos po med pa'o //
analyzed: mi gnyis pa ni dngos po med pa'o //
translated: Nonduality is a nonexistent thing.‚Äù

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das gnyis zhes bgyi ba ni ji lta bu lags /üîΩbcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das gnyis zhes bgyi ba ni ji lta bu lags / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: Subh≈´ti said, ‚ÄúBlessed One, what is called duality?‚Äù

original: rab 'byor gzugs kyi 'du shes ni gnyis so //üîΩtshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i 'du shes ni gnyis so //
analyzed: rab 'byor gzugs kyi 'du shes ni gnyis so // tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i 'du shes ni gnyis so //
translated: The Blessed One said, ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, the perception of form is duality.üîΩThe perception of feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness is duality.

original: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i 'du shes ni gnyis so //
analyzed: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i 'du shes ni gnyis so //
translated: The perception of the sense spheres, elements, and dependent origination is duality.

original: blang ba dang dor ba'i 'du shes ni gnyis so //
analyzed: blang ba dang dor ba'i 'du shes ni gnyis so //
translated: The notion of accepting and rejecting is dualistic.

original: bsam gtan dang po dang / bsam gtan gnyis pa dang / bsam gtan gsum pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi pa dang / byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms dang / nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa dang /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po dang / bsam gtan gnyis pa dang / bsam gtan gsum pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi pa dang / byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms dang / nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa dang /
translated: The notion of the first concentration, the second concentration, the third concentration, the fourth concentration, love, compassion, joy, equanimity, the meditative absorption of the sense field of infinite space,

original: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa dang / cung zad med pa'i skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa'i 'du shes ni gnyis so //
analyzed: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa dang / cung zad med pa'i skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa'i 'du shes ni gnyis so //
translated: the meditative absorption of the sense field of infinite consciousness, the meditative absorption of the sense field of nothing-at-all, and the meditative absorption of the sense field of neither perception nor non-perception is dualistic.

original: sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa dang / chos rjes su dran pa dang / dge 'dun rjes @185a * //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa dang / chos rjes su dran pa dang / dge 'dun rjes @185a * //
translated: The notion of recollecting the Buddha, recollecting the Dharma, recollecting the Sa·πÖgha,

original: su dran pa dang / tshul khrims rjes su dran pa dang / gtong pa rjes su dran pa dang / lha rjes su dran pa dang / skye ba rjes su dran pa dang / dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba rjes su dran pa dang / 'chi ba rjes su dran pa dang /
analyzed: su dran pa dang / tshul khrims rjes su dran pa dang / gtong pa rjes su dran pa dang / lha rjes su dran pa dang / skye ba rjes su dran pa dang / dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba rjes su dran pa dang / 'chi ba rjes su dran pa dang /
translated: mindfulness of inhalation and exhalation,üîΩmindfulness of death,üîΩand the perception of the aspects of the body.

original: lus kyi rnam pa rjes su dran pa'i 'du shes ni gnyis so //
analyzed: lus kyi rnam pa rjes su dran pa'i 'du shes ni gnyis so //
translated: There are two:üîΩthe perception of impermanence,üîΩthe perception of suffering,üîΩthe perception of non-self,üîΩthe perception of the unattractive,

original: mi rtag pa'i 'du shes dang / sdug bsngal gyi 'du shes dang / bdag med pa'i 'du shes dang / mi sdug pa'i 'du shes dang / dngos po med pa'i 'du shes dang / bdag gi 'du shes dang / sems can gyi 'du shes dang /
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i 'du shes dang / sdug bsngal gyi 'du shes dang / bdag med pa'i 'du shes dang / mi sdug pa'i 'du shes dang / dngos po med pa'i 'du shes dang / bdag gi 'du shes dang / sems can gyi 'du shes dang /
translated: the perception of non-existence,üîΩthe perception of self,üîΩthe perception of sentient beings,

original: srog gi 'du shes dang / skye ba'i 'du shes dang ; gso ba'i 'du shes dang / skyes bu'i 'du shes dang / gang zag gi 'du shes dang / shed las skyes kyi 'du shes dang / shed bu'i 'du shes dang / byed pa po'i 'du shes dang /
analyzed: srog gi 'du shes dang / skye ba'i 'du shes dang ; gso ba'i 'du shes dang / skyes bu'i 'du shes dang / gang zag gi 'du shes dang / shed las skyes kyi 'du shes dang / shed bu'i 'du shes dang / byed pa po'i 'du shes dang /
translated: the notion of life, the notion of birth, the notion of nourishment, the notion of person, the notion of individual, the notion of creature, the notion of soul, the notion of one who does,

original: tshor ba po'i 'du shes dang / shes pa po'i 'du shes dang / mthong ba po'i 'du shes ni gnyis so //
analyzed: tshor ba po'i 'du shes dang / shes pa po'i 'du shes dang / mthong ba po'i 'du shes ni gnyis so //
translated: the notion of one who feels, the notion of one who knows, the notion of one who sees,

original: rtag pa'i 'du shes dang / bde ba'i 'du shes dang / sdug pa'i 'du shes dang / bdag gi 'du shes ni gnyis so //
analyzed: rtag pa'i 'du shes dang / bde ba'i 'du shes dang / sdug pa'i 'du shes dang / bdag gi 'du shes ni gnyis so //
translated: the notion of permanence, the notion of happiness, the notion of purity, the notion of self,

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams kyi 'du shes ni gnyis so //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams kyi 'du shes ni gnyis so //
translated: the notion of the factors of awakening,

original: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang ; mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu'i 'du shes ni gnyis so //
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang ; mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu'i 'du shes ni gnyis so //
translated: the notion of the emptiness meditative stabilization, the signless meditative stabilization, the wishless meditative stabilization, the eight liberations, and the nine serial meditative stabilizations,

original: rtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / rtog pa med pa la dpyod pa tsam gyi ting nge 'dzin dang / rtog pa med cing dpyod pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi 'du shes ni gnyis so //üîΩsdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / kun 'byung 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / 'gog pa 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / lam 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / sdug bsngal shes pa dang / kun 'byung shes pa dang / 'gog pa shes pa dang /
analyzed: rtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / rtog pa med pa la dpyod pa tsam gyi ting nge 'dzin dang / rtog pa med cing dpyod pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi 'du shes ni gnyis so // sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / kun 'byung 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / 'gog pa 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / lam 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / sdug bsngal shes pa dang / kun 'byung shes pa dang / 'gog pa shes pa dang /
translated: The perception of the concentration with applied thought and sustained thought, the concentration without applied thought but with sustained thought only, and the concentration without applied thought and without sustained thought.üîΩThe perception of the noble truth of suffering, the noble truth of the origin of suffering, the noble truth of the cessation of suffering, and the noble truth of the path to the cessation of suffering; the knowledge of suffering, the knowledge of the origin of suffering, the knowledge of the cessation of suffering,üîΩthe knowledge of the path to the cessation of suffering, the knowledge of destruction, the knowledge of non-arising, the knowledge of dharmas, the knowledge of subsequent realization, the conventional knowledge, the knowledge of the path, and the knowledge in accordance with reality.

original: lam shes pa dang / zad pa shes pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa dang / chos shes pa dang / rjes su 'gro ba shes pa dang / kun rdzob shes pa dang / 'dris pa shes pa dang / sgra ji bzhin pa shes pa'i 'du shes ni gnyis so //
analyzed: lam shes pa dang / zad pa shes pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa dang / chos shes pa dang / rjes su 'gro ba shes pa dang / kun rdzob shes pa dang / 'dris pa shes pa dang / sgra ji bzhin pa shes pa'i 'du shes ni gnyis so //
translated: The perception of the knowledge of the four noble truths, the knowledge of destruction, the knowledge of non-arising, the knowledge of dharmas, the knowledge of subsequent realization, the conventional knowledge, the knowledge of the path, and the knowledge in accordance with reality.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad kyi 'du shes ni gnyis so //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad kyi 'du shes ni gnyis so //
translated: The notion of all the perfections and all the emptinesses is dualistic.

original: mngon par shes pa drug dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad @185b dang ; gzungs kyi sgo thams cad dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa drug dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad @185b dang ; gzungs kyi sgo thams cad dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang /
translated: The notion of the six superknowledges, all the concentrations, all the dhƒÅra·πáƒ´ gateways, the ten powers of the tathƒÅgatas, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, great love,

original: snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar gyi 'du shes ni gnyis so ;
analyzed: snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar gyi 'du shes ni gnyis so ;
translated: and up to the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha is dualistic.

original: / rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi 'du shes ni gnyis so //
analyzed: / rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi 'du shes ni gnyis so //
translated: The notion of a stream enterer, once-returner, non-returner, worthy one, pratyekabuddha, bodhisattva, and unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening is dualistic.

original: 'dus byas kyi khams kyi 'du shes dang ; 'dus ma byas kyi khams kyi 'du shes ni gnyis so //üîΩrab 'byor de ltar de ji snyed du 'du shes dang bcas pa thams cad dang / de ji snyed du 'du shes med pa de dag thams cad ni gnyis te /
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi khams kyi 'du shes dang ; 'dus ma byas kyi khams kyi 'du shes ni gnyis so // rab 'byor de ltar de ji snyed du 'du shes dang bcas pa thams cad dang / de ji snyed du 'du shes med pa de dag thams cad ni gnyis te /
translated: The perception of the compounded element and the perception of the uncompounded element are dualistic.üîΩTo the extent, Subh≈´ti, that there is perception, to that extent there is duality;

original: ji tsam du gnyis pa de tsam du dngos po'o //
analyzed: ji tsam du gnyis pa de tsam du dngos po'o //
translated: to the extent that there is duality, to that extent there is an entity;

original: ji tsam du dngos po yod pa de tsam du 'khor ba'o//
analyzed: ji tsam du dngos po yod pa de tsam du 'khor ba'o//
translated: to the extent that there is an entity, to that extent there is sa·πÉsƒÅra;

original: ji tsam du 'khor ba de tsam du sems can rnams skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrugs pa las yongs su mi 'grol lo //
analyzed: ji tsam du 'khor ba de tsam du sems can rnams skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrugs pa las yongs su mi 'grol lo //
translated: to the extent that there is sa·πÉsƒÅra, to that extent there is the non-liberation of beings from birth, aging, sickness, death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, dejection, and anguish.

original: 'du shes thams cad yid la mi byed pa de ni gnyis su med pa ste /
analyzed: 'du shes thams cad yid la mi byed pa de ni gnyis su med pa ste /
translated: The non-attention to all perceptions is non-duality.

original: rab 'byor rnam grangs des kyang 'di ltar gnyis kyi 'du shes can la sbyin pa med pa dang / tshul khrims med pa dang / bzod pa med pa dang / brtson 'grus med pa dang / bsam gtan med pa dang / shes rab med pa dang /
analyzed: rab 'byor rnam grangs des kyang 'di ltar gnyis kyi 'du shes can la sbyin pa med pa dang / tshul khrims med pa dang / bzod pa med pa dang / brtson 'grus med pa dang / bsam gtan med pa dang / shes rab med pa dang /
translated: there is no morality, there is no patience, there is no perseverance, there is no concentration, there is no wisdom,

original: lam med pa dang / thob pa med pa dang / mngon par rtogs pa med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: lam med pa dang / thob pa med pa dang / mngon par rtogs pa med par rig par bya'o //
translated: there is no path, there is no attainment, and there is no clear realization.

original: rab 'byor gnyis kyi 'du shes can la ni chung du na mthun pa'i bzod pa yang med na /
analyzed: rab 'byor gnyis kyi 'du shes can la ni chung du na mthun pa'i bzod pa yang med na /
translated: ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, for those with a perception of duality there is not even the patience that is in accordance with that,

original: gzugs yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /üîΩtshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: gzugs yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: so how could there be the thorough knowledge of form?üîΩHow could there be the thorough knowledge of feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness?

original: skye mched dang ; khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: skye mched dang ; khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: How could there be the thorough knowledge of the sense spheres, elements, or dependent origination?

original: blang ba dang / dor ba yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: blang ba dang / dor ba yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: How could they understand what to adopt and what to reject?

original: bsam gtan dang po dang / bsam gtan gnyis pa dang / bsam gtan gsum pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi pa dang / @186a * //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po dang / bsam gtan gnyis pa dang / bsam gtan gsum pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi pa dang / @186a * //
translated: How could they understand the first concentration, the second concentration, the third concentration, and the fourth concentration?

original: byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms dang / nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa dang / cung zad med pa'i skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa dang /
analyzed: byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms dang / nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa dang / cung zad med pa'i skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa dang /
translated: How could they understand the meditative absorption of loving kindness, the meditative absorption of compassion, the meditative absorption of joy, the meditative absorption of equanimity, the meditative absorption of the sense field of infinite space, the meditative absorption of the sense field of infinite consciousness, the meditative absorption of the sense field of nothing-at-all,

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: and the meditative absorption of the sense field of neither perception nor non-perception?

original: sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa dang / chos rjes su dran pa dang / chos rjes su dran pa dang / dge 'dun rjes su dran pa dang / tshul khrims rjes su dran pa dang / gtod ba rjes su dran pa dang / lha rjes su dran pa dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa dang / chos rjes su dran pa dang / chos rjes su dran pa dang / dge 'dun rjes su dran pa dang / tshul khrims rjes su dran pa dang / gtod ba rjes su dran pa dang / lha rjes su dran pa dang /
translated: How could they understand the recollection of the Buddha, the recollection of the Dharma, the recollection of the Sa·πÖgha, the recollection of ethical discipline, the recollection of generosity, the recollection of the deities,

original: skye ba rjes su dran pa dang / dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba rjes su dran pa dang / 'chi ba rjes su dran pa dang / lus kyi rnam pa rjes su dran pa yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: skye ba rjes su dran pa dang / dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba rjes su dran pa dang / 'chi ba rjes su dran pa dang / lus kyi rnam pa rjes su dran pa yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: the recollection of birth, the recollection of the inhalation and exhalation of breath, the recollection of death, and the knowledge of the aspects of the body?

original: mi rtag pa'i 'du shes dang / sdug bsngal ba'i 'du shes dang / bdag med pa'i 'du shes dang / mi sdug pa'i 'du shes dang / dngos po med pa'i 'du shes dang / bdag gi 'du shes dang / sems can gyi 'du shes dang /
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i 'du shes dang / sdug bsngal ba'i 'du shes dang / bdag med pa'i 'du shes dang / mi sdug pa'i 'du shes dang / dngos po med pa'i 'du shes dang / bdag gi 'du shes dang / sems can gyi 'du shes dang /
translated: How could they understand the perception of impermanence, the perception of suffering, the perception of no-self, the perception of repulsiveness, the perception of non-entityness, the perception of self, the perception of sentient beings,

original: srog gi 'du shes dang / skye ba'i 'du shes dang / gso ba'i 'du shes dang / skyes bu'i 'du shes dang / gang zag gi 'du shes dang / shed las skyes kyi 'du shes dang / shed bu'i 'du shes dang / byed pa po'i 'du shes dang /
analyzed: srog gi 'du shes dang / skye ba'i 'du shes dang / gso ba'i 'du shes dang / skyes bu'i 'du shes dang / gang zag gi 'du shes dang / shed las skyes kyi 'du shes dang / shed bu'i 'du shes dang / byed pa po'i 'du shes dang /
translated: how could they understand the notion of life, the notion of birth, the notion of nourishment, the notion of a person, the notion of an individual, the notion of a human being, the notion of a human, the notion of an agent,

original: tshor ba po'i 'du shes dang / shes pa po'i 'du shes dang / mthong ba po'i 'du shes yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: tshor ba po'i 'du shes dang / shes pa po'i 'du shes dang / mthong ba po'i 'du shes yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: the notion of a feeler, the notion of a knower, and the notion of a seer?

original: rtag pa'i 'du shes dang / bde ba'i 'du shes dang / sdug pa'i 'du shes dang / bdag gi 'du shes yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: rtag pa'i 'du shes dang / bde ba'i 'du shes dang / sdug pa'i 'du shes dang / bdag gi 'du shes yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: How could they understand the notion of permanence, the notion of happiness, the notion of beauty, and the notion of a self?

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: How could they understand the dharmas on the side of awakening?

original: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: How could they understand the emptiness meditative stabilization, the signlessness meditative stabilization, the wishlessness meditative stabilization, the eight deliverances, or the nine serial absorptions?

original: rtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / rtog pa med pa la dpyod pa tsam gyi ting nge 'dzin dang / rtog pa med cing dpyod pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: rtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / rtog pa med pa la dpyod pa tsam gyi ting nge 'dzin dang / rtog pa med cing dpyod pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: How could they understand the meditative stabilization that is both investigative and analytical, the meditative stabilization that is non-investigative but analytical, or the meditative stabilization that is neither investigative nor analytical?

original: sdug bsngal 'phags @186b pa'i bden pa dang / kun 'byung 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / 'gog pa 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / lam 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / sdug bsngal shes pa dang / kun 'byung ba shes pa dang / 'gog pa shes pa dang /
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'phags @186b pa'i bden pa dang / kun 'byung 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / 'gog pa 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / lam 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / sdug bsngal shes pa dang / kun 'byung ba shes pa dang / 'gog pa shes pa dang /
translated: How could they understand the four noble truths‚Äîthe noble truth of suffering, the noble truth of the arising of suffering, the noble truth of the cessation of suffering, and the noble truth of the path? How could they understand the knowledge of suffering, the knowledge of the arising of suffering, the knowledge of the cessation of suffering, and the knowledge of the path?

original: lam shes pa dang / zad pa shes pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa dang / chos shes pa dang / rjes su 'gro ba shes pa dang / kun rdzob shes pa dang / 'dris pa shes pa dang / sgra ji bzhin pa shes pa yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: lam shes pa dang / zad pa shes pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa dang / chos shes pa dang / rjes su 'gro ba shes pa dang / kun rdzob shes pa dang / 'dris pa shes pa dang / sgra ji bzhin pa shes pa yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: How could they understand the knowledge of the path, the knowledge of termination, the knowledge of nonarising, the knowledge of phenomena, the knowledge of subsequent classes, the knowledge of conventions, the knowledge of the familiar, or the knowledge that accords with what has been said?

original: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: How could they understand all the perfections, all the emptinesses,

original: mngon par shes pa drug dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang / gzungs kyi sgo thams cad dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / byams pa chen po dang /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa drug dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang / gzungs kyi sgo thams cad dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / byams pa chen po dang /
translated: the six superknowledges, all the meditative stabilizations, all the dhƒÅra·πáƒ´ gateways, the powers of the tathƒÅgatas, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, great love,

original: snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos 'dres pa rnams yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos 'dres pa rnams yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: great compassion, or the mixed qualities of a buddha?

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du yongs su shes par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: How could they fully understand the fruit of entering the stream, the fruit of being tied to one more rebirth, the fruit of no longer being subject to rebirth, arhatship, individual enlightenment, or even the knowledge of all things?

original: gang la lam sgom pa med pa de la rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'ang ga la yod /
analyzed: gang la lam sgom pa med pa de la rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'ang ga la yod /
translated: How could they have the fruit of entering the stream if they do not cultivate the path?

original: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar yang ga la yod /
analyzed: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar yang ga la yod /
translated: How could they have the fruit of being tied to one more rebirth, the fruit of no longer being subject to rebirth, arhatship, individual enlightenment, or even the knowledge of all things?

original: bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa yang ga la yod /
analyzed: bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa yang ga la yod /
translated: How could they have the relinquishment of all the disturbing emotions along with the instincts?

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Subh≈´ti said to the Lord:üîΩ‚ÄúLord, it is amazing how deeply this perfection of wisdom has been purified, and how great the perfection of wisdom is!

original: bcom ldan 'das gal te de ltar dngos po'i 'du shes can la mthun pa'i bzod pa yang ma mchis pas thob pa lta ga la mchis te ma mchis /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal te de ltar dngos po'i 'du shes can la mthun pa'i bzod pa yang ma mchis pas thob pa lta ga la mchis te ma mchis /
translated: Blessed One, if it is like that, then how could there be attainment for those who have the perception of entities? There could not be!

original: mngon par rtogs pa lta ga la mchis te ma mchis na /
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa lta ga la mchis te ma mchis na /
translated: How could there be clear realization? There could not be!

original: ci lags / bcom ldan 'das dngos po ma mchis pa'i 'du shes can la mthun pa'i bzod pa'am /
analyzed: ci lags / bcom ldan 'das dngos po ma mchis pa'i 'du shes can la mthun pa'i bzod pa'am /
translated: Blessed One, is it the case that those who have the perception of nonentities have the acceptance that accords with that?

original: dkar po rnam par mthong ba'i sa'am /
analyzed: dkar po rnam par mthong ba'i sa'am /
translated: Is it the case that they have the ground of seeing what is white?

original: rigs kyi sa'am /
analyzed: rigs kyi sa'am /
translated: Is it the case that they have the ground of the family?

original: brgyad pa'i sa'am /üîΩmthong pa'i sa'am /
analyzed: brgyad pa'i sa'am / mthong pa'i sa'am /
translated: Is it the case that they have the ground of the eighth?üîΩIs it the case that they have the ground of seeing?

original: @187a * // bsrabs pa'i sa'am /
analyzed: @187a * // bsrabs pa'i sa'am /
translated: Is it the case that they have the ground of thinning?

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sa'am /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sa'am /
translated: Is it the case that they have the ground of freedom from attachment?

original: byas pa rtogs pa'i sa'am /
analyzed: byas pa rtogs pa'i sa'am /
translated: Is it the case that they have the ground of realizing what has been done?

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa'am /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa'am /
translated: Is it the case that they have the ground of the solitary buddhas?

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa'am /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa'am /
translated: Is it the case that they have the ground of the bodhisattvas?

original: sangs rgyas kyi sa'am /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sa'am /
translated: Is it the case that they have the ground of the buddhas?

original: lam sgom pa gang la rten cing nyon mongs pa gang gis bsgribs pas byang chub sems dpa'i skyon ma mchis par chud par mi 'gyur ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i skyon ma mchis par ma chud pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma thob pas bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad mi spong ba'i sgrib pa nyan thos dang ldan pa'am /
analyzed: lam sgom pa gang la rten cing nyon mongs pa gang gis bsgribs pas byang chub sems dpa'i skyon ma mchis par chud par mi 'gyur ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i skyon ma mchis par ma chud pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma thob pas bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad mi spong ba'i sgrib pa nyan thos dang ldan pa'am /
translated: What is the obscuration that consists in the non-abandonment of all the latent impressions of moral defilement? It is the obscuration that consists in the moral defilement of the non-penetration of the bodhisattva's state of purity on account of the path being cultivated in dependence on which and on account of the moral defilement that obscures.üîΩ

original: rang sangs rgyas dang ldan pa'i nyon mongs pa de dag yongs su spong bar 'gyur ba'i lam mchis sam /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas dang ldan pa'i nyon mongs pa de dag yongs su spong bar 'gyur ba'i lam mchis sam /
translated: ‚ÄúLord, is there a path on which one relies and through which one abandons the afflictions that would prevent a bodhisattva from entering into the secure state of a bodhisattva, and, having entered into the secure state of a bodhisattva, would prevent him from attaining the knowledge of all aspects?

original: bcom ldan 'das gal te chos skye bar 'gyur ba gang yang skye ba ma mchis na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal te chos skye bar 'gyur ba gang yang skye ba ma mchis na /
translated: ‚ÄúLord, if there is no arising of any dharma at all,

original: ji ltar chos de dag ma bskyed par rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar chos de dag ma bskyed par rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur /
translated: how will bodhisattvas, having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, attain the knowledge of all aspects?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor de de bzhin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor de de bzhin no //
translated: ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, it is so!

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: It is just as you have said!

original: dngos po med pa'i 'du shes can la mthun pa'i bzod pa med do //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i 'du shes can la mthun pa'i bzod pa med do //
translated: There is no acceptance of what is suitable for those with the perception of the absence of entities.

original: mngon par rtogs pa'i sa med do //
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa'i sa med do //
translated: There is no level of clear realization.

original: dkar po rnam par mthong ba'i sa med do //
analyzed: dkar po rnam par mthong ba'i sa med do //
translated: There is no level of seeing the white [dharma].

original: rigs kyi sa med do //
analyzed: rigs kyi sa med do //

original: brgyad pa'i sa med do //
analyzed: brgyad pa'i sa med do //
translated: There is no eighth-¬≠level.

original: mthong ba'i sa med do //
analyzed: mthong ba'i sa med do //
translated: There is no level of seeing.

original: bsrabs pa'i sa med do //
analyzed: bsrabs pa'i sa med do //
translated: There is no level of thinning.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sa med do //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sa med do //
translated: There is no level of separation from desire.

original: byas pa rtogs pa'i sa med do //
analyzed: byas pa rtogs pa'i sa med do //
translated: There is no level of realization of what has been done.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa med do //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa med do //
translated: There is no pratyekabuddha level.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa med do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa med do //
translated: There is no bodhisattva level.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sa med do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sa med do //
translated: There is no buddha level.

original: lam sgom pa gang la brten cing nyon mongs pa gang gis bsgribs pas byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par chud par mi 'gyur ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par ma chud pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par mi 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: lam sgom pa gang la brten cing nyon mongs pa gang gis bsgribs pas byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par chud par mi 'gyur ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par ma chud pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par mi 'gyur ba dang /
translated: What is the path that is cultivated, and what is the affliction that obscures it, such that one does not enter into the flawlessness of the bodhisattva, and, not having entered into the flawlessness of the bodhisattva, does not attain omniscience?

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma thob pas bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad mi spong pa'i sgrib pa nyan thos dang ldan pa'am /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma thob pas bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad mi spong pa'i sgrib pa nyan thos dang ldan pa'am /
translated: The obscuration consisting in the non-dispersal of the mind is the non-abandonment of all the latent impressions of moral defilement because of the non-attainment of the knowledge of all the aspects.üîΩ

original: rang sangs rgyas dang ldan pa'i nyon mongs pa de dag spong bar 'gyur ba'i lam med do //üîΩgsol pa / bcom ldan 'das ci lags /üîΩbyang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /

translated: Because they have not attained the knowledge of all aspects, they do not have the path for eliminating the afflictions that are the connection of the latent afflictions, the afflictions of ≈õrƒÅvakas or pratyekabuddhas.üîΩ‚Äù

original: dngos po @187b mchis par 'du shes pa dang / dngos po ma mchis par 'du shes pa mchis sam /

original: gzugs su 'du shes pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes par 'du shes pa dang / skye mched dang / khams su 'du shes pa dang / 'dod chags su 'du shes pa dang / 'dod chags spang bar 'du shes pa dang /

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
