translated: The Blessed One replied,üîΩ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, in the nature of the nonexistence of things, bodhisattva great beings have a gradual practice, a gradual training, and a gradual application, through which they fully awaken to unsurpassed and perfect buddhahood.

original: rab 'byor 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos thog mar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dag dang / sangs rgyas mang po la bsnyen bkur ba'i dgra bcom pa dag dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos thog mar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dag dang / sangs rgyas mang po la bsnyen bkur ba'i dgra bcom pa dag dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang /
translated: Subh≈´ti, it is because bodhisattva great beings first of all from the buddhas, the blessed ones, from the bodhisattva great beings, from the worthy ones who have attended on many buddhas,üîΩfrom the non-returners,

original: lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / rgyun du zhugs pa dag las sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / rang sangs rgyas dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid dang /
analyzed: lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / rgyun du zhugs pa dag las sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / rang sangs rgyas dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid dang /
translated: from the once-returners, from the stream enterers, from the buddhas, the blessed ones, who are the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature, from the bodhisattva great beings who are the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature, from the pratyekabuddhas who are the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature, from the worthy ones who are the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature, from the non-returners who are the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature, from the once-returners who are the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature, and from the stream enterers who are the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature, have learned this perfection of wisdom, have trained in it, and have become fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: dgra bcom pa rnams dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / phyir mi 'ong ba rnams dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba rnams dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / rgyun du zhugs pa rnams dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid dang /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa rnams dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / phyir mi 'ong ba rnams dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba rnams dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / rgyun du zhugs pa rnams dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid dang /
translated: the arhats as the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature, the nonreturners as the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature, the once-returners as the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature, the stream entrants as the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature,

original: 'phags pa thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / 'du byed rnams ni ngo bo nyid chung du na skra'i rtse mo'i cha shas kyi gnas tsam yang med do zhes bya bar thos nas /
analyzed: 'phags pa thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / 'du byed rnams ni ngo bo nyid chung du na skra'i rtse mo'i cha shas kyi gnas tsam yang med do zhes bya bar thos nas /
translated: and all the noble ones as the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature, and that conditioned things do not even have an intrinsic nature the size of the tip of a hair.üîΩ‚ÄúWhen the bodhisattva great beings hear this,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ci @190a * //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ci @190a * //
translated: what do they think?

original: ste ; sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyang dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dang / dgra bcom pa rnams dang / phyir mi 'ong ba rnams dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba rnams dang /
analyzed: ste ; sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyang dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dang / dgra bcom pa rnams dang / phyir mi 'ong ba rnams dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba rnams dang /
translated: The buddhas, the blessed ones, are the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature, the bodhisattva great beings are the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature, the arhats are the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature, the nonreturners are the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature, the once-returners are the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature,

original: rgyun du zhugs pa rnams kyang dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin na /üîΩgal te bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyang rung /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa rnams kyang dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin na / gal te bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyang rung /
translated: and the stream-enterers are also the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature,üîΩwhether I fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening

original: gal te mngon par rdzogs par sangs ma rgyas kyang rung ste /
analyzed: gal te mngon par rdzogs par sangs ma rgyas kyang rung ste /
translated: or whether I do not fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,

original: chos thams cad ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin gyi /
translated: all phenomena are the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature.

original: ci nas kyang bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par byas te /
analyzed: ci nas kyang bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par byas te /
translated: I will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening

original: sems can dngos po'i 'du shes la spyod pa thams cad dngos po med pa la rab tu dgod par bya'o snyam ste /
analyzed: sems can dngos po'i 'du shes la spyod pa thams cad dngos po med pa la rab tu dgod par bya'o snyam ste /
translated: and will establish all sentient beings who experience the perception of an entity in the nonexistence of an entity.‚Äô

original: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de sems can thams cad yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i phyir bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par 'jug ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de sems can thams cad yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i phyir bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par 'jug ste /
translated: Subh≈´ti, that bodhisattva great being has set out for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening in order to lead all sentient beings to complete nirvƒÅ·πáa.

original: mthar gyis pa'i bya ba dang / mthar gyis pa'i bslab pa dang / mthar gyis pa'i sgrub pa gang la bslabs pas sngon gyi byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par gyur pa de lta bu'i mthar gyis pa'i bya ba dang /
analyzed: mthar gyis pa'i bya ba dang / mthar gyis pa'i bslab pa dang / mthar gyis pa'i sgrub pa gang la bslabs pas sngon gyi byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par gyur pa de lta bu'i mthar gyis pa'i bya ba dang /
translated: the practice, training, and accomplishment of the stages, by which the bodhisattvas of the past attained unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: mthar gyis pa'i bslab pa dang / mthar gyis pa'i sgrub pa rtsom mo //
analyzed: mthar gyis pa'i bslab pa dang / mthar gyis pa'i sgrub pa rtsom mo //
translated: ‚ÄúI will practice the practice, training, and accomplishment of the stages.‚Äù

original: de thog mar sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
analyzed: de thog mar sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
translated: ‚ÄúFirst, I will practice the perfection of generosity, the perfection of good conduct, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: and the perfection of wisdom.‚Äù

original: mthar gyis pa'i mngon par rtogs par spyir bkod pa yin no /
analyzed: mthar gyis pa'i mngon par rtogs par spyir bkod pa yin no /
translated: This is the general presentation of the clear realization of the serial [training].

original: // / rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
analyzed: // / rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
translated: Furthermore, Subh≈´ti, from the time when a bodhisattva great being first gives rise to [the mind set on] awakening,

original: de sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: de sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: when he practices the perfection of generosity,

original: bdag kyang sbyin pa yongs su gtong ngo //
analyzed: bdag kyang sbyin pa yongs su gtong ngo //
translated: he himself gives gifts.

original: pha rol yang sbyin pa la rab 'jog go //
analyzed: pha rol yang sbyin pa la rab 'jog go //
translated: He establishes others in generosity.

original: sbyin pa'i legs pa brjod do //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i legs pa brjod do //
translated: He speaks in praise of generosity.

original: sems can gzhan gang sbyin pa yongs su @190b gtong ba de dag gi yang legs pa brjod cing mthun pas dga' bar spyod do //
analyzed: sems can gzhan gang sbyin pa yongs su @190b gtong ba de dag gi yang legs pa brjod cing mthun pas dga' bar spyod do //
translated: He speaks in praise of others giving gifts as well, and he rejoices in harmony with them.

original: de sbyin pa des longs spyod kyi phung po chen po thob nas ser sna med pa'i sems kyis sbyin pa yongs su gtong bar byed de /üîΩzas 'dod pa la ni zas skom 'dod pa la ni skom /
analyzed: de sbyin pa des longs spyod kyi phung po chen po thob nas ser sna med pa'i sems kyis sbyin pa yongs su gtong bar byed de / zas 'dod pa la ni zas skom 'dod pa la ni skom /
translated: Through that generosity, he attains a great mass of wealth, and he gives gifts with a mind free of stinginess.

original: bzhon pa 'dod pa la ni bzhon pa /üîΩgis  'dod pa la ni gos /
analyzed: bzhon pa 'dod pa la ni bzhon pa / gis  'dod pa la ni gos /
translated: To those who desire food, he gives food. To those who desire drink, he gives drink.üîΩTo those who desire vehicles, he gives vehicles.üîΩTo those who desire clothes, he gives clothes.

original: spos 'dod pa la ni spos /
analyzed: spos 'dod pa la ni spos /
translated: To those who desire incense, he gives incense.

original: phreng ba 'dod pa la ni phreng ba /üîΩbyug pa 'dod pa la ni byug pa /
analyzed: phreng ba 'dod pa la ni phreng ba / byug pa 'dod pa la ni byug pa /
translated: To those who want a rosary, he gives a rosary.üîΩTo those who want perfume, he gives perfume.

original: mal cha 'dod pa la ni mal cha /
analyzed: mal cha 'dod pa la ni mal cha /
translated: To those who want a bed, he gives a bed.

original: gnas 'dod pa la ni gnas /
analyzed: gnas 'dod pa la ni gnas /
translated: To those who want a dwelling, he gives a dwelling.

original: mar med 'dod pa la ni mar me gtong ba nas /
analyzed: mar med 'dod pa la ni mar me gtong ba nas /
translated: To those who want a lamp, he gives a lamp.

original: mi'i yo byed gang ci yang rung ba dag kyang de la gtong ba'i bar du ste ;
analyzed: mi'i yo byed gang ci yang rung ba dag kyang de la gtong ba'i bar du ste ;
translated: He gives whatever human goods there are.

original: de sbyin pa de nyid kyis sems can rnams tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / rnam par grol ba dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba la rab tu 'god par byed do //
analyzed: de sbyin pa de nyid kyis sems can rnams tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / rnam par grol ba dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba la rab tu 'god par byed do //
translated: And by that very generosity, he establishes beings in morality, in concentration, in wisdom, in liberation, and in the knowledge and vision of liberation.

original: de tshul khrims kyi phung po dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po dang / shes rab kyi phung po dang / rnam par grol ba'i phung po dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i phung po de nyid dang ldan pas nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sa las 'das nas byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa 'jug go //
analyzed: de tshul khrims kyi phung po dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po dang / shes rab kyi phung po dang / rnam par grol ba'i phung po dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i phung po de nyid dang ldan pas nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sa las 'das nas byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa 'jug go //
translated: Endowed with that very aggregate of morality, aggregate of concentration, aggregate of wisdom, aggregate of liberation, and aggregate of the knowledge and vision of liberation, he passes beyond the ≈õrƒÅvaka and pratyekabuddha levels and enters into the certainty of the bodhisattva.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par zhugs nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par zhugs nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed do //
translated: Having entered into the certainty of the bodhisattva, he purifies the buddhafield.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byas nas sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byas nas sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed do //
translated: Having purified the buddhafield, he brings beings to maturity.

original: sems can rnams yongs su smin par byas nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par byed do //
analyzed: sems can rnams yongs su smin par byas nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par byed do //
translated: Having brought beings to maturity, he attains the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par byas nas chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par byas nas chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ro //
translated: Having attained the knowledge of all aspects, he turns the wheel of the Dharma.

original: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor nas sems can rnams theg pa gsum la so sor 'god par byed do //
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor nas sems can rnams theg pa gsum la so sor 'god par byed do //
translated: having turned the wheel of the Dharma, he establishes sentient beings in the three vehicles.

original: theg pa gsum la so sor bkod nas 'khor pa las yongs su grol bar byed do //
analyzed: theg pa gsum la so sor bkod nas 'khor pa las yongs su grol bar byed do //
translated: Having established them in the three vehicles, he liberates them from sa·πÉsƒÅra.

original: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pas mthar gyis pa'i bya ba rab tu 'dogs te /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pas mthar gyis pa'i bya ba rab tu 'dogs te /
translated: In this way, Subh≈´ti, the bodhisattva great being, having gradually set up the practice of giving,

original: mthar gyis pa'i bslab pa dang / mthar gyis pa'i sgrub pa rab tu 'dogs te /
analyzed: mthar gyis pa'i bslab pa dang / mthar gyis pa'i sgrub pa rab tu 'dogs te /
translated: having gradually set up the training and the practice,

original: de thams cad kyang dmigs su med do //
analyzed: de thams cad kyang dmigs su med do //
translated: all of which cannot be apprehended,

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?üîΩBecause they have no intrinsic nature.

original: de ni 'di ltar de la ngo bo nyid med do zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i mthar gyis pa'i mngon par rtogs pa yin no /üîΩ// / rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub @191a * //
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar de la ngo bo nyid med do zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i mthar gyis pa'i mngon par rtogs pa yin no / // / rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub @191a * //
translated: This is the successive realization of the perfection of giving.

original: sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
analyzed: sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
translated: Furthermore, Subh≈´ti, the bodhisattva great being, from the first production of the thought of awakening onward,

original: bdag kyang tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //
analyzed: bdag kyang tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //
translated: I too practice the perfection of morality.

original: gzhan yang tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yang dag par bskul lo //
analyzed: gzhan yang tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yang dag par bskul lo //
translated: I encourage others to practice the perfection of morality.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i legs pa brjod do //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i legs pa brjod do //
translated: I praise the perfection of morality.üîΩI rejoice in the practice of the perfection of morality by others.üîΩI request the Buddhas to teach the perfection of morality.

original: gzhan tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa de dag gi yang legs pa brjod cing mthun pas dga' bar spyod do //
analyzed: gzhan tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa de dag gi yang legs pa brjod cing mthun pas dga' bar spyod do //
translated: I dedicate all these roots of virtue to great enlightenment.üîΩI rejoice in the morality of all Buddhas and Bodhisattvas.üîΩBy this root of virtue, may all beings have perfect morality.üîΩBy this root of virtue, may all beings have the morality of the Buddhas.üîΩBy this root of virtue, may all beings have the morality of the Bodhisattvas.üîΩBy this root of virtue, may all beings have the morality of the Solitary Sages.üîΩBy this root of virtue, may all beings have the morality of the Hearers.üîΩBy this root of virtue, may all beings have the morality of the gods.üîΩBy this root of virtue, may all beings have the morality of human beings.üîΩBy this root of virtue, may all beings have the morality of the Brahma gods.

original: de tshul khrims des sems can rnams lha'i che ba nyid dang mi'i che ba nyid rab tu thob par byed do //üîΩde nor med pa'i sems can rnams la nor byin zhing tshul khrims la rab tu 'god pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / rnam par grol ba dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba la rab tu 'god do //
analyzed: de tshul khrims des sems can rnams lha'i che ba nyid dang mi'i che ba nyid rab tu thob par byed do //üîΩde nor med pa'i sems can rnams la nor byin zhing tshul khrims la rab tu 'god pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / rnam par grol ba dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba la rab tu 'god do //
translated: By this root of virtue, may all beings have the morality of the gods of the pure abodes.üîΩBy this root of virtue, may all beings have the morality of the gods of the desire realm.üîΩBy this root of virtue, may all beings have the morality of the gods of the form realm.üîΩBy this root of virtue, may all beings have the morality of the gods of the formless realm.üîΩBy this root of virtue, may all beings have the morality of the gods of the realm of the Great Brahma.üîΩBy this root of virtue, may all beings have the morality of the gods of the realm of the Highest Heaven.üîΩBy this root of virtue, may all beings have the morality of the gods of the realm of the Heaven of Pure Abodes.üîΩBy this root of virtue, may all beings have the morality of the gods of the realm of the Heaven of Joy.üîΩBy this root of virtue, may all beings have the morality of the gods of the realm of the Heaven of the Thirty-three.üîΩBy this root of virtue, may all beings have the morality of the gods of the realm of the Heaven of the Four Great Kings.üîΩBy this root of virtue, may all beings have the morality of the gods of the realm of the Heaven of the Thirty-three.üîΩBy this root of virtue, may all beings have the morality of the gods of the

original: de tshul khrims kyi phung po dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po dang / shes rab kyi phung po dang / rnam par grol ba'i phung po dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i phung po des nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sa las 'das nas tshul khrims kyi phung po dang /
analyzed: de tshul khrims kyi phung po dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po dang / shes rab kyi phung po dang / rnam par grol ba'i phung po dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i phung po des nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sa las 'das nas tshul khrims kyi phung po dang /
translated: Through that aggregate of morality, aggregate of concentration, aggregate of wisdom, aggregate of liberation, and aggregate of the knowledge and vision of liberation, having transcended the levels of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas, through that very aggregate of morality,

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po dang / shes rab kyi phung po dang / rnam par grol ba'i phung po dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i phung po de nyid kyis byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par 'jug go //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po dang / shes rab kyi phung po dang / rnam par grol ba'i phung po dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i phung po de nyid kyis byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par 'jug go //
translated: aggregate of concentration, aggregate of wisdom, aggregate of liberation, and aggregate of the knowledge and vision of liberation, they enter into the faultlessness of the bodhisattvas.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par zhugs nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par zhugs nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed do //
translated: Having entered into the faultlessness of the bodhisattvas, they purify a buddhafield.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byas nas sems can yongs su smin par byed do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byas nas sems can yongs su smin par byed do //
translated: Having purified a buddhafield, they bring beings to maturity.

original: sems can yongs su smin par byas nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par byed do //
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par byas nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par byed do //
translated: having brought beings to maturity, they cause them to attain the knowledge of all modes.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par byas nas chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par byas nas chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ro //
translated: having caused them to attain the knowledge of all modes, they set rolling the wheel of the Dharma.

original: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor nas sems can rnams theg pa gsum la so sor 'god do //

analyzed: de thams cad kyang dmigs su med do //

analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi legs pa brjod do //

original: chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid la yod pa'am med pa zhig dmigs su yod snyam mam /
analyzed: chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid la yod pa'am med pa zhig dmigs su yod snyam mam /
translated: ‚ÄúDo you think that in the intrinsic identity of the unreality of all things, there is anything to be apprehended as existent or nonexistent?‚Äù

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subh≈´ti replied,

original: bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags te /
translated: ‚ÄúNo, Lord.

original: chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid la mchis pa'am ma mchis pa mi dmigs so //
analyzed: chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid la mchis pa'am ma mchis pa mi dmigs so //
translated: In the intrinsic identity of the unreality of all things, there is nothing to be apprehended as existent or nonexistent.‚Äù

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor 'o na ci'i phyir khyod de ltar gal te chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin na gzugs kyang med /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'o na ci'i phyir khyod de ltar gal te chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin na gzugs kyang med /
translated: ‚ÄúWell then, Subh≈´ti, why do you say, ‚ÄòIf all things are the intrinsic identity of unreality, then form is not,

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'ang med /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'ang med /
translated: feeling, perception, impulse, and consciousness are not;

original: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'ang med /
analyzed: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'ang med /
translated: the sense fields, elements, and dependent origination are not;

original: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams kyang med /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams kyang med /
translated: the perfections, emptinesses, and factors of awakening are not;

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang ; tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang ; tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
translated: the concentrations, the immeasurables, the formless absorptions, the liberations, the complete liberations, the emptiness, the signless,

original: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / byams pa chen po dang /
analyzed: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / byams pa chen po dang /
translated: the wishless, the clairvoyances, the meditative stabilizations, the dhƒÅra·πáƒ´ gateways, the powers of the tathƒÅgatas, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, great love,

original: snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyang med /
analyzed: snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyang med /
translated: great compassion, and the distinct attributes of a buddha would not exist.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi bar yang med /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi bar yang med /
translated: The knowledge of a knower of all aspects would not exist.

original: sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun yang med /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun yang med /
translated: Buddhas, the Dharma, and the Sa·πÖgha would not exist.

original: lam yang med /
analyzed: lam yang med /
translated: The path would not exist.

original: 'bras bu yang med /
analyzed: 'bras bu yang med /
translated: The result would not exist.

original: nyon mongs pa yang med /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa yang med /
translated: Afflictions would not exist.

original: rnam par byang ba yang med /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba yang med /
translated: there is no purification,

original: 'thob pa'ang med /
analyzed: 'thob pa'ang med /
translated: there is no attainment,

original: mngon par rtogs pa'ang med /
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa'ang med /
translated: there is no clear realization,

original: chos thams cad kyang med do zhes bya bar sems par gyur /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyang med do zhes bya bar sems par gyur /
translated: and there are no phenomena.‚Äù

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subh≈´ti said,

original: bcom ldan 'das @198b bdag ni chos 'di dag la ner nur yang ma mchis /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das @198b bdag ni chos 'di dag la ner nur yang ma mchis /
translated: ‚ÄúBlessed One, I am not confused about these phenomena,

original: the tshom yang ma mchis te /
analyzed: the tshom yang ma mchis te /
translated: and I have no doubts.

original: 'on kyang bcom ldan 'das ma byung ba'i dus na dge slong nyan thos kyi theg pa pa'am /
analyzed: 'on kyang bcom ldan 'das ma byung ba'i dus na dge slong nyan thos kyi theg pa pa'am /
translated: However, Blessed One, in the future there will be monks who are followers of the ≈örƒÅvakayƒÅna,

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pa'am /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pa'am /
translated: followers of the PratyekabuddhayƒÅna,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa dag 'di skad du /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa dag 'di skad du /
translated: and followers of the BodhisattvayƒÅna who will say,

original: gal te chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin na /
analyzed: gal te chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin na /
translated: ‚ÄòIf all phenomena are the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature,

original: chos thams cad dngos po med pa la su zhig kun nas nyon mongs pa'am /üîΩrnam par byang bar 'gyur zhes mchi zhing /
analyzed: chos thams cad dngos po med pa la su zhig kun nas nyon mongs pa'am / rnam par byang bar 'gyur zhes mchi zhing /
translated: then who is defiled or purified in the nonexistence of all phenomena?‚Äô

original: de dag kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba ma 'tshal bas tshul khrims log par 'gyur /
analyzed: de dag kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba ma 'tshal bas tshul khrims log par 'gyur /
translated: They will not understand defilement and purification, and their morality will be perverted.

original: lta ba log par 'gyur /
analyzed: lta ba log par 'gyur /
translated: their view will be wrong,

original: spyod pa log par 'gyur /
analyzed: spyod pa log par 'gyur /
translated: their practice will be wrong,

original: 'tsho ba log par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'tsho ba log par 'gyur te /
translated: and their livelihood will be wrong.üîΩ‚ÄúBecause of their wrong morality, wrong view, wrong practice, and wrong livelihood, they will be reborn in one of the three lower realms:

original: tshul khrims log par gyur pa dang / lta ba log par gyur pa dang / spyod pa log par gyur pa dang / 'tsho ba log par gyur pas de dag sems can dmyal ba'am /üîΩbyol song gi skye gnas sam /
analyzed: tshul khrims log par gyur pa dang / lta ba log par gyur pa dang / spyod pa log par gyur pa dang / 'tsho ba log par gyur pas de dag sems can dmyal ba'am / byol song gi skye gnas sam /
translated: in the hells,üîΩin the animal realm,

original: gshin rje'i 'jig rten gyi ngan song gsum las gcig tu mchis par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gshin rje'i 'jig rten gyi ngan song gsum las gcig tu mchis par 'gyur te /

original: bcom ldan 'das bdag gis ma byung ba'i 'jig pa de mthong nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bdag gis ma byung ba'i 'jig pa de mthong nas /
translated: Blessed One, when I see this future destruction,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la don de zhu ba lags kyis bcom ldan 'das bdag ni chos 'di dag la nem nur ram the tshom ma mchis so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la don de zhu ba lags kyis bcom ldan 'das bdag ni chos 'di dag la nem nur ram the tshom ma mchis so //
translated: I ask the Thus-Gone One, the Worthy One, the Perfect Buddha about this matter. Blessed One, I have no doubts or uncertainties about these teachings.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor legs so legs so //üîΩde de bzhin te /
analyzed: rab 'byor legs so legs so // de de bzhin te /
translated: ‚ÄúExcellent, Subh≈´ti, excellent!

original: ji skad du smra ba de bzhin no //
analyzed: ji skad du smra ba de bzhin no //
translated: It is just as you have said.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Subh≈´ti said to the Lord:

original: bcom ldan 'das gal te chos thams cad dngos po ma mchis pa'i ngo bo nyid lags na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal te chos thams cad dngos po ma mchis pa'i ngo bo nyid lags na /
translated: ‚ÄúLord, if all dharmas are the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature,

original: don gyi dbang ci zhig mthong na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems can rnams kyi don gyi slad du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'jug pa lags /üîΩbcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: don gyi dbang ci zhig mthong na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems can rnams kyi don gyi slad du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'jug pa lags / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: seeing what benefit do bodhisattva great beings set out for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening for the sake of beings?‚Äù

original: rab 'byor gang gi phyir chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa de nyid kyi phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'jug ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor gang gi phyir chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa de nyid kyi phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'jug ste /
translated: The Lord said, ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, it is precisely because all dharmas are the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature that bodhisattva great beings set out for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: rab 'byor dmigs pa ni rgya chung ba ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor dmigs pa ni rgya chung ba ste /
translated: Subh≈´ti, an objective support is a small thing.

original: dmigs pa'i 'du shes can la thob pa med do //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i 'du shes can la thob pa med do //
translated: There is no attainment for one with the perception of an objective support.‚Äù

original: mngon par rtogs pa med do //
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa med do //
translated: there is no realization,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub med do //üîΩ@199a * // gsol pa /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub med do // @199a * // gsol pa /
translated: and there is no unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: bcom ldan 'das dmigs pa ma mchis pa la thob pa'am /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das dmigs pa ma mchis pa la thob pa'am /
translated: ≈öƒÅriputra then asked, ‚ÄúBlessed One, is there attainment,

original: mngon par rtogs pa'am /
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa'am /
translated: realization,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mchis sam /üîΩbcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mchis sam / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: or unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening in the absence of apprehending anything?‚Äù

original: rab 'byor chos kyi dbyings la rnam par 'khrug pa med pa'i phyir mi dmigs pa nyid thob pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor chos kyi dbyings la rnam par 'khrug pa med pa'i phyir mi dmigs pa nyid thob pa'o //

original: mi dmigs pa nyid mngon par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa nyid mngon par rtogs pa'o //
translated: the realization is the absence of apprehending anything,

original: mi dmigs pa nyid bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub po //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa nyid bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub po //
translated: and the unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening is the absence of apprehending anything.

original: gang mi dmigs pa la thob pa'am /
analyzed: gang mi dmigs pa la thob pa'am /
translated: Anyone who wants to attain,

original: mngon par rtogs pa'am /
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa'am /
translated: realize,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'dod pa de ni chos kyi dbyings la rnam par 'khrug par 'dod du zad do //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'dod pa de ni chos kyi dbyings la rnam par 'khrug par 'dod du zad do //
translated: or perfectly and completely awaken to the absence of apprehending anything is just wanting to disturb the realm of phenomena.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das gal te de ltar dmigs pa ma mchis pa la yang 'thob pa ma mchis /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das gal te de ltar dmigs pa ma mchis pa la yang 'thob pa ma mchis /
translated: He asked, ‚ÄúBlessed One, if there is no attainment,

original: mngon par rtogs pa ma mchis /
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa ma mchis /
translated: no clear realization,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ma mchis la /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ma mchis la /
translated: and no unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening in the absence of apprehending,

original: mi dmigs pa nyid thob pa /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa nyid thob pa /
translated: and if it is non-apprehending that attains,

original: mi dmigs pa nyid mngon par rtogs pa /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa nyid mngon par rtogs pa /
translated: non-apprehending that realizes,

original: mi dmigs pa nyid bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub lags na /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa nyid bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub lags na /
translated: and non-apprehending that is unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sa dang po yang ga la mchis /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sa dang po yang ga la mchis /
translated: then, Blessed One, how can there be the first ground of a bodhisattva great being?

original: sa gnyis pa yang ga la mchis /
analyzed: sa gnyis pa yang ga la mchis /
translated: How can there be the second ground?

original: sa gsum pa yang ga la mchis /
analyzed: sa gsum pa yang ga la mchis /
translated: How can there be the third ground?

original: sa bcu pa'i bar yang ga la mchis /
analyzed: sa bcu pa'i bar yang ga la mchis /

original: mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa yang ga la mchis /
analyzed: mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa yang ga la mchis /
translated: How can there be acceptance of the fact that phenomena are not produced?

original: rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i mngon par shes pa yang ga la mchis /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i mngon par shes pa yang ga la mchis /
translated: How can there be the clairvoyances that arise from the ripening of karma?

original: rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i sbyin pa'ang ga la mchis /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i sbyin pa'ang ga la mchis /
translated: How can there be the generosity that arises from the ripening of karma?

original: rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyang ga la mchis /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyang ga la mchis /
translated: How could there be morality, patience, perseverance, concentration, and wisdom that arise from karmic ripening?

original: rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams kyang ga la mchis /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams kyang ga la mchis /
translated: How could there be the factors of awakening that arise from karmic ripening?

original: rnam par smin pa'i chos de dag la gnas shing sems can rnams yongs su smin par bgyis pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bgyid pa dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la zhal zas dang / btung ba dang / na bza' dang /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i chos de dag la gnas shing sems can rnams yongs su smin par bgyis pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bgyid pa dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la zhal zas dang / btung ba dang / na bza' dang /
translated: Abiding in those dharmas that arise from karmic ripening, they bring sentient beings to maturity, purify a buddhafield, and offer food, drink, clothing,

original: gzims cha dang / pho brang dang / yo byad dang / me tog dang / bdug spos dang / spos dang / phreng ba dang / byug pa dang / phye ma dang / chos gos dang / @199b gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan dang /
analyzed: gzims cha dang / pho brang dang / yo byad dang / me tog dang / bdug spos dang / spos dang / phreng ba dang / byug pa dang / phye ma dang / chos gos dang / @199b gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan dang /
translated: beds, houses, necessities, flowers, incense, perfume, garlands, ointments, powders, Dharma robes, parasols, victory banners, and flags to the lord buddhas.

original: mar me dang / phreng ba dang / lha dang mi'i phun sum tshogs pa gzhan gang yang rung ba dag gis rim gro bgyid cing de la de dag rgyun mi 'chad par yongs su mya ngan las 'das kyi bar du sku gdung dang / nyan thos dag la rnam par smin par gyur kyang pas bar mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: mar me dang / phreng ba dang / lha dang mi'i phun sum tshogs pa gzhan gang yang rung ba dag gis rim gro bgyid cing de la de dag rgyun mi 'chad par yongs su mya ngan las 'das kyi bar du sku gdung dang / nyan thos dag la rnam par smin par gyur kyang pas bar mi 'gyur na /
translated: or with lamps, or with garlands, or with any other human or divine perfections, and they would do this continuously until they had passed into complete nirvƒÅ·πáa, and even after that they would continue to do so for a hundred thousand ko·π≠is of nayutas of eons,

original: bcom ldan 'das de ci'i slad du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos kyi dbyings rnam par 'khrug par bgyid par mi 'gyur ram /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ci'i slad du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos kyi dbyings rnam par 'khrug par bgyid par mi 'gyur ram /
translated: then, Blessed One, why would the bodhisattva great being not disturb the dharma-constituent?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor gang gi phyir mi dmigs pa de nyid kyi phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos kyi dbyings rnam par 'khrug par mi byed de /
analyzed: rab 'byor gang gi phyir mi dmigs pa de nyid kyi phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos kyi dbyings rnam par 'khrug par mi byed de /
translated: ‚ÄúSu¬≠bh≈´ti, it is because of precisely this non-apprehension that the bodhisattva great beings do not disturb the dharma-constituent.

original: de nyid kyi phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sa dang po yod do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sa dang po yod do //
translated: It is precisely because of this that the level of the bodhisattva great beings exists.

original: de nyid kyi phyir sa gnyis pa dang / sa gsum pa dang / sa bcu pa'i bar du yod do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir sa gnyis pa dang / sa gsum pa dang / sa bcu pa'i bar du yod do //
translated: Therefore, the second ground, the third ground, up to the tenth ground exist.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa yod do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa yod do //
translated: Therefore, there is patience with regard to dharmas that do not arise.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i mngon par shes pa yod do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i mngon par shes pa yod do //
translated: Therefore, there are superknowledges that arise from the ripening of karma.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab yod do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab yod do //
translated: Therefore, there is giving, morality, patience, effort, concentration, and wisdom that arise from the ripening of karma.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams yod do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams yod do //
translated: Therefore, there are the factors of awakening that arise from the ripening of karma.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams te /
translated: Therefore, there are roots of virtue that arise from the ripening of karma.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed do //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed do //
translated: With those roots of virtue, the bodhisattva mahƒÅsattva brings beings to maturity.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed do //
translated: He purifies the Buddha-field.üîΩHe serves the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, with food and drink, clothes, bedding, houses, and utensils, with flowers, incense, perfumes, garlands, ointments,üîΩpowders, religious robes, parasols, banners, and flags, with lamps, and with all the other objects of desire of gods and men, and he does not cease to do so until he has attained supreme enlightenment.üîΩAnd even when he has attained supreme enlightenment, his service will not cease, until he has established in final Nirvana all the living beings who have been helped by him and whom he has matured.üîΩAnd even after they have attained final Nirvana, his service will not cease, until their Relics have been worshipped and their Shrines erected.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la yang zhal zas dang / btung ba dang / na bza' dang / gzims cha dang / pho brang dang / yo byad dang / me tog dang / bdug spos dang / spos dang / phreng ba dang / byug pa dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la yang zhal zas dang / btung ba dang / na bza' dang / gzims cha dang / pho brang dang / yo byad dang / me tog dang / bdug spos dang / spos dang / phreng ba dang / byug pa dang /
translated: And even after the Relics have been worshipped and the Shrines erected, his service will not cease, until he has entered final Nirvana.üîΩAnd even after he has entered final Nirvana, his service will not cease, until the Doctrine has disappeared.üîΩAnd even after the disappearance of the Doctrine, his service will not cease, until the Shrines of the Doctrine have been worshipped.üîΩAnd even after the Shrines of the Doctrine have been worshipped, his service will not cease, until the Relics have been gathered together and placed in one place.üîΩAnd even after the Relics have been gathered together and placed in one place, his service will not cease, until he has worshipped them with all the worship of gods and men.

original: phye ma dang / chos gos dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan dang / mar me dang / lha dang / mi'i phun sum tshogs pa gzhan gang yang rung ba dag gis rim gro byed cing de la de dag la rgyun mi 'chad par yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i sku gdung rnams kyi bar dang /
analyzed: phye ma dang / chos gos dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan dang / mar me dang / lha dang / mi'i phun sum tshogs pa gzhan gang yang rung ba dag gis rim gro byed cing de la de dag la rgyun mi 'chad par yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i sku gdung rnams kyi bar dang /
translated: And even after he has worshipped them with all the worship of gods and men, his service will not cease, until he has entered final Nirvana.üîΩAnd even after he has entered final Nirvana, his service will not cease, until the Doctrine of the Disciples has disappeared.

original: nyan thos dag la rnam par smin par gyur kyang zad par mi 'gyur ro //üîΩgsol pa / bcom ldan 'das mi dmigs @200a * //
analyzed: nyan thos dag la rnam par smin par gyur kyang zad par mi 'gyur ro //üîΩgsol pa / bcom ldan 'das mi dmigs @200a * //
translated: And even after the Doctrine of the Disciples has disappeared, his service will not cease, until the Doctrine of the Solitary Buddhas has disappeared.üîΩAnd even after the Doctrine of the Solitary Buddhas has disappeared, his service will not cease, until the Doctrine of the Bodhisattvas has disappeared.üîΩAnd even after the Doctrine of the Bodhisattvas has disappeared, his service will not cease, until the Doctrine of the Tathagatas has disappeared.üîΩAnd even after the Doctrine of the Tathagatas has disappeared, his service will not cease, until the Relics have been worshipped.üîΩAnd even after the Relics have been worshipped, his service will not cease, until he has entered final

original: pa dang / sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / mngon par shes pa rnams la bye brag ni ci zhig mchis /
analyzed: pa dang / sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / mngon par shes pa rnams la bye brag ni ci zhig mchis /
translated: What is the difference between the perfections of giving, morality, patience, vigor, meditation, and wisdom, and the superknowledges?

original: tha dad du bgyi ba ni ci zhig mchis /
analyzed: tha dad du bgyi ba ni ci zhig mchis /
translated: What is the distinction between them?‚Äù

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /üîΩrab 'byor mi dmigs pa dang / sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / mngon par shes pa rnams la tha dad du bya ba gang yang med do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / rab 'byor mi dmigs pa dang / sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / mngon par shes pa rnams la tha dad du bya ba gang yang med do //
translated: The Lord said:üîΩ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, there is no distinction at all between nonapprehending and the perfections of giving, morality, patience, vigor, meditation, and wisdom, and the superknowledges.üîΩSubh≈´ti, there is no distinction at all between unattached giving, morality, patience, vigor, meditation, and wisdom, and the unattached superknowledges.‚Äù

original: rab 'byor gos pa med pa'i sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang ; bsam gtan dang / shes rab dang / gos pa med pa'i mngon par shes pa dag la tha dad du bya ba bstan to //
analyzed: rab 'byor gos pa med pa'i sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang ; bsam gtan dang / shes rab dang / gos pa med pa'i mngon par shes pa dag la tha dad du bya ba bstan to //
translated: ‚ÄúLord, if there is no distinction at all between nonapprehending and the perfections of giving, morality, patience, vigor, meditation, and wisdom, and the superknowledges, and if there is no distinction at all between unattached giving, morality, patience, vigor, meditation, and wisdom, and the unattached superknowledges, then what is the distinction between the perfection of wisdom of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and the perfection of wisdom of the bodhisattvas, the great beings?‚Äù

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das gos pa ma mchis pa'i sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab dang / mngon par shes pa rnams la ji ltar tha dad du bgyi ba bstan /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das gos pa ma mchis pa'i sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab dang / mngon par shes pa rnams la ji ltar tha dad du bgyi ba bstan /
translated: He asked, ‚ÄúBlessed One, how are the generosity, discipline, patience, diligence, concentration, insight, and supernormal knowledge that are unattached to be taught?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied,

original: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /üîΩsbyin pa mi dmigs /üîΩgtong ba mi dmigs /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe / sbyin pa mi dmigs / gtong ba mi dmigs /
translated: ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, here, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of insight,üîΩthey give gifts without observing the gift,

original: len pa mi dmigs par sbyin pa gtong ngo //
analyzed: len pa mi dmigs par sbyin pa gtong ngo //
translated: the giver, or the recipient.

original: tshul khrims mi dmigs par tshul khrims srung ngo //
analyzed: tshul khrims mi dmigs par tshul khrims srung ngo //
translated: They guard discipline without observing discipline.

original: bzod pa mi dmigs par bzod pa sgom mo //
analyzed: bzod pa mi dmigs par bzod pa sgom mo //
translated: They cultivate patience without observing patience.

original: brtson 'grus mi dmigs par brtson 'grus rtsom mo //
analyzed: brtson 'grus mi dmigs par brtson 'grus rtsom mo //
translated: They undertake diligence without observing diligence.

original: ting nge 'dzin mi dmigs par ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug go //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin mi dmigs par ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug go //
translated: They rest in concentration without observing concentration.

original: shes rab mi dmigs par shes rab sgom mo //
analyzed: shes rab mi dmigs par shes rab sgom mo //
translated: They cultivate insight without observing insight.

original: mngon par shes pa mi dmigs par mngon par shes pa rnams la spyod do //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa mi dmigs par mngon par shes pa rnams la spyod do //
translated: They practice the applications of mindfulness without apprehending the applications of mindfulness.üîΩThey practice the right efforts, legs of miraculous power, faculties, powers, limbs of awakening, and path without apprehending the path.üîΩThey practice the formless absorptions without apprehending the formless absorptions.üîΩThey practice the emptiness, signlessness, and aspirationlessness without apprehending emptiness, signlessness, and aspirationlessness.üîΩThey practice the emptiness, signlessness, and aspirationlessness without apprehending the emptiness, signlessness, and aspirationlessness.üîΩThey practice the liberations without apprehending the liberations.üîΩThey practice the totalities without apprehending the totalities.üîΩThey practice the aspects of the path without apprehending the aspects of the path.üîΩThey practice the aspects of the formless absorptions without apprehending the aspects of the formless absorptions.üîΩThey practice the aspects of the immeasurables without apprehending the aspects of the immeasurables.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams mi dmigs par dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams la spyod do //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams mi dmigs par dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams la spyod do //
translated: They practice the aspects of the applications of mindfulness without apprehending the aspects of the applications of mindfulness.üîΩThey practice the aspects of the right efforts without apprehending the aspects of the right efforts.üîΩThey practice the aspects of the legs of miraculous power without apprehending the aspects of the legs of miraculous power.üîΩThey practice the aspects of the faculties without apprehending the aspects of the faculties.üîΩThey practice the aspects of the powers without apprehending the aspects of the powers.üîΩThey practice the aspects of the limbs of awakening without apprehending the aspects of the limbs of awakening.

original: yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / lam mi dmigs par lam la spyod do //
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / lam mi dmigs par lam la spyod do //
translated: They practice the aspects of the path without apprehending the aspects of the path.üîΩThey practice the aspects of the noble truths without apprehending the aspects of the noble truths.üîΩThey practice the aspects of dependent origination without apprehending the aspects of dependent origination.üîΩThey practice the aspects of the concentrations without apprehending the aspects of the concentrations.üîΩThey practice the aspects of the formless absorptions without apprehending the aspects of the formless absorptions.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams mi dmigs par gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams la spyod do //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams mi dmigs par gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams la spyod do //
translated: They practice the aspects of the immeasurables without apprehending the aspects of the immeasurables.üîΩThey practice the aspects of the applications of mindfulness without apprehending the aspects of the applications of mindfulness.

original: rnam par thar pa rnams dang / mthar @200b gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams mi dmigs par mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams la spyod do //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa rnams dang / mthar @200b gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams mi dmigs par mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams la spyod do //
translated: They practice the aspects of the right efforts without apprehending the aspects of the right efforts.üîΩThey practice the aspects of the legs of miraculous power without apprehending the aspects of the legs of miraculous power

original: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa mi dmigs par smon pa med pa la spyod do //
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa mi dmigs par smon pa med pa la spyod do //
translated: They practice the emptiness of internal phenomena without apprehending emptiness, and they practice the emptiness of external phenomena, the emptiness of both external and internal phenomena, the emptiness of emptiness, the emptiness of great extent, the emptiness of ultimate reality, the emptiness of conditioned phenomena, the emptiness of unconditioned phenomena, the emptiness of the unlimited, the emptiness of that which has neither beginning nor end, the emptiness of non-dispersal, the emptiness of inherent existence, the emptiness of all things, the emptiness of intrinsic defining characteristics, the emptiness of non-apprehension, the emptiness of non-entities, and the emptiness of essential nature without apprehending emptiness.

original: mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams mi dmigs par so so yang dag par rig pa rnams la spyod do //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams mi dmigs par so so yang dag par rig pa rnams la spyod do //
translated: They practice the ten powers of the tathƒÅgatas, the four fearlessnesses, and the four detailed and thorough knowledges without apprehending the four detailed and thorough knowledges.üîΩThey practice the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha without apprehending the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams mi dmigs par sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams la spyod do //
analyzed: byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams mi dmigs par sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams la spyod do //
translated: They practice the great love without apprehending the great love, and they practice the great compassion, the great joy, and the great equanimity without apprehending the great equanimity.

original: sems can rnams mi dmigs par sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed do //
analyzed: sems can rnams mi dmigs par sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed do //
translated: They practice the thirty-seven aspects of enlightenment without apprehending the thirty-seven aspects of enlightenment.üîΩThey practice the ten tathƒÅgata powers, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha without apprehending the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.üîΩThey practice the great love without apprehending the great love, and they practice the great compassion, the great joy, and the great equanimity without apprehending the great equanimity.üîΩThey practice the thirty-seven aspects of enlightenment without apprehending the thirty-seven aspects of enlightenment.üîΩThey practice the ten perfections without apprehending the ten perfections.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing mi dmigs par sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing mi dmigs par sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed do //
translated: They practice the emptiness, signlessness, and aspirationlessness that are doors to liberation without apprehending the emptiness, signlessness, and aspirationlessness that are doors to liberation.üîΩThey practice the four concentrations without apprehending the four concentrations, and they practice the four immeasurables and the four formless absorptions without apprehending the four immeasurables and the four formless absorptions.üîΩThey practice the five eyes without apprehending the five eyes, and they practice the six clairvoyances without apprehending the six clairvoyances.üîΩThey practice the thirty-two major marks of a great being without apprehending the thirty-two major marks of a great being, and they practice the eighty minor marks without

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams mi dmigs par byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams mi dmigs par byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
translated: and the qualities of a buddha are not apprehended, he will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: rab 'byor de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //
translated: In that way, Subh≈´ti, bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom by way of not apprehending anything.

analyzed: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na /
translated: Subh≈´ti, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom like that,

original: de la bdud sdig can rnams sam /
analyzed: de la bdud sdig can rnams sam /
translated: it is hard for the evil MƒÅras,üîΩor the gods of MƒÅra‚Äôs class, to get at them.‚Äù

original: bdud kyi ris kyi lha rnams kyis thub par dka' ba yin no zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du shes pa'i mthar gyis pa'i mngon par rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: bdud kyi ris kyi lha rnams kyis thub par dka' ba yin no zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du shes pa'i mthar gyis pa'i mngon par rtogs pa yin no //
translated: This is the successive clear realization that all phenomena are the nature of nonentity.

translated: The Ornament of Clear Realization, which is a commentary on the twenty-five thousand verse Perfection of Wisdom Sutra, was composed by the noble Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´.üîΩ

original: pa'i le'u ste drug pa'o /
analyzed: pa'i le'u ste drug pa'o /
translated: The chapter on the training in gradual engagement, which is made from the perspective of the serial realizations, is the sixth chapter of the Ornament of Clear Realization, which is a commentary on the perfection of wisdom in 25,000 lines that follows the noble mother.üîΩThus have I heard.

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /

translated: They do not have the notion that they are two.

original: mtshan rnams dang / dpe byad bzang po rnams gang mngon par sgrub pa de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su zin par mngon par sgrub ste /
analyzed: mtshan rnams dang / dpe byad bzang po rnams gang mngon par sgrub pa de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su zin par mngon par sgrub ste /
translated: He accomplishes the major marks and minor signs by being seized by the perfection of wisdom.

original: de la gnyis kyi 'du shes su mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la gnyis kyi 'du shes su mi 'gyur ro //
translated: He does not have the notion of duality in regard to them.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: ≈öƒÅriputra said, ‚ÄúLord, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: ji ltar na sbyin pa gtong ba dang / de la gnyis kyi 'du shes su mi 'gyur ba lags /
analyzed: ji ltar na sbyin pa gtong ba dang / de la gnyis kyi 'du shes su mi 'gyur ba lags /
translated: how is it that they give gifts and do not have the notion of duality in regard to that?

original: ji ltar na tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab sgom pa dang / de gnyis kyi 'du shes su mi 'gyur ba lags /
analyzed: ji ltar na tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab sgom pa dang / de gnyis kyi 'du shes su mi 'gyur ba lags /
translated: How is it that they cultivate morality, patience, perseverance, concentration, and wisdom and do not have the notion of duality in regard to that?

original: ji ltar na nang stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du sgom pa dang / de la gnyis kyi 'du shes su mi 'gyur ba lags /
analyzed: ji ltar na nang stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du sgom pa dang / de la gnyis kyi 'du shes su mi 'gyur ba lags /
translated: How is it that they cultivate inner emptiness, up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature and do not have the notion of duality in regard to that?
